@ Apurva Thirani, ref-F/B-412/14- The enquiry officer visited the spot that day & prosecuted the following motorcycles parked illegally on the footpath there in accordance with law-
1. WB14J 2084
2.WB 01Z 3392
3. WB 07D 3460
4. WB 24J 9087, barring the same no other vehicle was found flouting rules.Regards.

@ Srinjoy Sen, ref-F/B-414/14- Consequent upon receiving your complaint pertaining to charges of unauthorised parking leveled against a vehicle bearing no. WB 02U 1419, prosecution was enforced under appropriate section of law vide case no. pgPC00002/14 since it could be substantiated from the available facts & circumstantial evidences. Regards.

@ Srinjoy Sen, ref-F/B-413/14- Consequent upon receiving your complaint pertaining to charges of unauthorised parking leveled against a vehicle bearing no. WB 06D 9599, prosecution was enforced under appropriate section of law vide case no. pgPC00001/14 since it could be substantiated from the available facts & circumstantial evidences. Regards.

@ Tapas Roy , ref-F/B-377/14- It is our constant endeavour to minimise congestion & ensure a safe, uninterrupted flow of traffic. Although one old autorickshaw stand operates from there & considerable number of vegetable vendors do congregate in the evening yet our officers are keeping strict vigilance to ensure smooth movement of both pedestrian & vehicular traffic. Regards.

@ Sohail Ahmed, ref-F/B-369/14- Please be informed that the pipes & cables as seen  in the picture which you had uploaded belongs to a telecom company who were in the process of laying cables all along the footpath, from our end however we had stacked the same to one side so as to enhance the available space on the footpath. It is also pertinent to mention that the barricades   meant for demarcating the "Bus Bay" cannot be removed since it facilitates streamlining the movement of north-bound buses & acts as a deterrent to curb overtaking tendencies. Regards.

@ Reshmi Ray Dasgupta........ ref. F/B- 425 dt- 14.05.14, this is to inform that you have not produced / submitted any evidence in support of your allegation. Enquiry conducted from other corners the allegation made by you could not be substantiated. Regards.

@ Rajib Basu  , ref-F/B-331/14- The mentioned place is located just behind(northern side) of Jodhpur Park Market besides many people used to park their vehicles at  the adjoining lanes & by lanes during the time of marketing in an indiscriminate manner specially on Rahim Ostagar Rd. The local residents also park their own car in front of the residence , however in order to curb the irregularities one side of each roads/lanes of the vicinity has been categorically transformed to "No Parking Zone" & officers too have intensified vigilance. Regards.

@ Minu Agarwal  , ref-F/B-299/14- The day you encountered parking related problems the traffic  officer had promptly arrived & redressed your grievance , you can always  get in touch with the concerned traffic guard for assistance in future too. Regards.

@ Rana PS , ref-F/B-262/14- Please be informed that Gokhale Road is a  fee parking zone  authorised by KMC on western side from Gol Mandir upto India Engineers Institute & further upto AJC Bose Road it is eastern side KMC fee parking . Our officers are vigilant to detect anomalies & enforce prosecution for contravention. Regards.
@ Sayantan Mondal  , ref-F/B-230/14-The traffic signal at the said intersection have been checked up but no irregularities are detected. Regards.

@ Vineet Ruia , ref-F/B-219/14-As many as 9 indiscriminate parking cases, 40clamp cases, 9 obstruction & 10 sticker cases have been made against double line or illegal parking on Brabourne Rd . KTP shall sustain such drives with greater intensity in future too to have more deterrence & officers are  vigilant & committed to enforce the same. Regards.

@ Ratul Das , ref-F/B-872/14- Please be informed that trimming of trees have been done along D.H. Road , Taratala Rd, Hide Rd, Sahapore Rd etc & all light signals are  clearly visible to commuters & motorists. Regards.

@ Umang Chirimar , ref-F/B-967/14-Please be informed that MG Road is a notified stretch all along as "ONE WAY" towards east only for buses & minibuses from 08.00 hrs to 21.00 hrs. Regarding the informative traffic signs it is pertinent to mention that a good number of proper signage are present at the appropriate places which you might have missed out due to the steadfast heavy traffic on MG road . In view of this realistic situation  more signages will be installed at various strategic places for better enforcement of traffic rules & regulations. Regards.

@ Anjan Dutta , ref-F/B-958/14-Jay Walking cases are regularly made to curb instances of haphazard movement of people, moreover signages directing "Use Foot Bridge" were placed in & around Ultadanga crossing to disseminate awareness. Strict enforcement is made against violation by auto rickshaws & taxis. Regards.

@ Rahul Deb Nath ,ref-F/B-865/14- You are requested to substantiate your complaint with corroborative evidence , moreover the mentioned stretch  is under the surveillance of CCTV & officers are regularly deployed to supervise & monitor flow of traffic. Regards.

@ Ravindra Agarwal, ref-F/B-1038/14- Errant drivers are regularly prosecuted so that smooth mobilization of traffic around the vicinity of Burdwan Rd remains unhindered. The authorities of  the marriage hall situated  at 7/2 Burdwan Rd have been apprised about the matter. Moreover, the local PS have also been asked to enquire. Regards.

@ Sayantan Dutta , ref-F/B-1030/14-Please take note that HGV's can ply along Goragacha Rd, Hellen Keler Sarani, Taratala Rd, Remount Rd etc as these roads come under the periphery of port activity where no restriction for goods vehicle prevails. Prosecution is made against vehicle's flouting restriction  norms along Diamond Harbour Rd, Judges Court Rd, Burdwan Rd, Sahapore Rd except during relaxation period. As many as 34 cases have been made during the months of October & November along DH Road & its vicinity. Regards.

@ Udayan Upadhyaya, ref-F/B-1043/14-Please be informed that there is a newly constructed bus/mini bus stand just few yards ahead of Kankurgachi crossing towards Maniktala.If autos are found standing in double line at the crossing or infront of bus stand then prosecution is made in accordance with law.  KTP is aware that such drives have to be  sustained with greater intensity & officers are vigilant to enforce the same. Regards.

T R A F F I C      R E G U L A T I O N S

Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the public in connection with the Kalpataru Utsav at Dakshineswar on 01.01.2015, I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of powers vested in me under Section 115, 117, 122 and 126 M V Act, 1988 and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act./ 39, 39(1b) of  Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 and 93 of Rules for the Regulations of Traffic in Kolkata and its suburbs and under sub-section(1) of Section 4 of the West Bengal Traffic Regulations Act, 1965  (W B Act XV of 1965) read with   Govt. of  West  Bengal  Home (Transport) Department Order No. 7605-WT, dated the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT / 3M- 34/99, dated the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all classes of vehicles and all kinds of traffic including pedestrian traffic for the city of Kolkata shall  be  regulated in the  manner  prescribed  below notwithstanding any other orders in force on 01.01.2015.

1)  No heavy or medium goods vehicles will be allowed to move towards north along B T             Road and Cossipore Road from 04.00 hrs. to 21.00 hrs. on 01.01.2015, instead they will take             Vidya Sagar Setu.

2)    No heavy or medium goods vehicles will be allowed to move towards north from the following road intersections from 04.00 hrs. to 21.00 hrs. on 01.01.2015.
     
a)    Rabindra Sarani & K K Tagore Street crossing.
     b)    Vivekananda Road & C R Avenue crossing.
     c)    Grey Street & B K Paul Avenue crossing.
     d)    Manicktala crossing.
e) Rabindra Sarani & B K Paul Avenue crossing.
     f)    Grey Street & Raja Dinendra Street crossing.
     g)    Gallif Street & Bidhan Sarani crossing.
     h)    Beliaghata Road & A J C Bose Road crossing.
     i)    Strand Road & K K Tagore Street crossing.
     j)    B T Road & Raja Manindra Road crossing.
     k)    B T Road & Dum Dum Road crossing.
     l)    B T Road & Kashinath Dutta Road crossing.
     m)    Cossipore Road & Khagen Chatterjee Road crossing.
     n)    Khirod Bidya Binod Avenue & Galiff Street crossing.
     o)    C R Avenue & New CIT Road crossing.
p) Vivekananda Road & Raja Dinendra Street.
q) C R Avenue and M G Road crossing.
r) M G Road and Rabindra Sarani crossing.

3)    Light motor vehicles meant for carrying goods will be restricted from moving northwards beyond  B T Road and Dum Dum Road intersection and Cossipore Road and Khagen Chatterjee Road intersection between 04.00 hrs and 16.00 hrs on 01.01.2015.

4) Light motor vehicles carrying goods and medium goods vehicles and heavy goods vehicles with a full laden height not exceeding 10' & 11' can move towards Jessore Road, via Dum Dum Road and Belgachia Road respectively on 01.01.2015.

 These vehicles will however find entry, if Barrackpore Police relaxes restrictions on B T Road or Cossipore Road and Gopal Lal Thakur Road from 14.00 hrs to 16.00 hrs on 01.01.2015.

5)    Goods vehicles may also be diverted from any of the arterial roads by the traffic police on duty as and when considered necessary to prevent them moving towards north along B T Road and              Cossipore Road on 01.01.2015.

6)  Vehicular traffic may also be diverted from any of the arterial and feeder roads by traffic police on    
 duty as and when considered necessary in the interest of the public on the day.

7)      THESE REGULATION WILL BE ENFORCED IN ADDITION TO THE OTHER NORMAL RESTRICTION ON THE DAY, WHICH ARE NOT REPUGNANT TO THE ABOVE.
 
            
                                * * * * * * * *

T R A F F I C      R E G U L A T I O N S

           
       Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the public in connection with the Kolkata Marathon on 28.12.2014, I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of powers vested in me under Section 115, 117, 122 and 126 M V Act, 1988 and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act./ 39, 39(1b) of  Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 and 93 of Rules for the Regulations of Traffic in Kolkata and its suburbs and under sub-section (1) of Section 4 of the West Bengal Traffic Regulations Act, 1965  (W B Act XV of 1965) read with   Govt. of  West  Bengal  Home (Transport) Department Order No. 7605-WT, dated the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT / 3M- 34/99, dated the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all classes of vehicles and all kinds of traffic including pedestrian traffic for the city of Kolkata shall  be  regulated in the  manner  prescribed  below, not with standing any other orders in force on the day.

1)       The following roads on the Kolkata Maidan areas shall be closed to vehicular traffic between 00.00 hrs and 11.30 hrs on 28.12.2014 or till the end of Marathon :-

a) Red Road.
b) Casuarina Avenue / Queensway.
c) Judges Court Road (from 07.00 hrs. to 08.30 hrs.)
d) Hospital Road (from 06.00 hrs. to 11.30 hrs.)
e) Esplanade Ramp (from 08.15 hrs to 11.30 hrs.)

2) Vehicles coming along Dufferin Road towards south will be diverted towards east from J & N Island along Outram Road, J L Nehru Road, etc. for their southward journey.

3) Vehicles coming along Khidderpore Road towards north will be diverted towards east from J & N Island along Outram Road, J L Nehru Road, etc. for their northward journey.

4) South bound vehicles of Red Road coming from north may be diverted through Esplanade Row (East) / R R Avenue, J L Nehru Road / Mayo Road, etc.

5) South bound vehicles of Strand Road may be diverted towards east along Kingsway, R R Avenue, Mayo Road / Dufferin Road, J L Nehru Road / Outram Road, etc. for their southward journey.

6) East bound vehicles from Hastings Crossing would be diverted towards Strand Road.

7) North bound vehicles on S.P.M. Road would be diverted towards Pratapaditya Road and Abdul Rasul Avenue.

8) Tram services along Khidderpore Road / Dufferin Road / Hazra Road / S.P.M. Road will be suspended from 05.00 hrs to 11.30 hrs on 28.12.2014 or till the Marathon is over according to the direction of traffic police on duty. 

9) Vehicular traffic may also be diverted/regulated/restricted on the following roads along the line of route of the Marathon as and when considered necessary by the traffic police on duty.

Queensway – Cathedral Road – AJC Bose Road – Hospital Road – Hospital Road (E) & (W) – Lovers Lane – Khidderpore Road – D L Khan Road – Belvedere Road – Baker Road – Judges Court Road – Kalighat Bridge – Hazra Road – S P Mukherjee Road – Rash Behari Avenue – Abdul Rasul Avenue – Chetla Bridge – Chetla Central Road – Alipore Road – Burdwan Road – D H Road – Judges Court Road – Alipore Road – St. Georges Gate Road – Strand Road – Kingsway.

10) Parking of vehicles will be allowed at the following locations on the day.

(a) Rangers Ground – for the invitees and dignitaries.
(b) Plassey Gate Road and Bangabasi Ground – for the participants.
(c) Calcutta University Ground – for OB Van and Media personnel.

11) Vehicular traffic may also be diverted from any of the arterial roads and feeder roads by the traffic police on duty as and when considered necessary in the interest of the public on the aforesaid date and time mentioned above. 

12)     These regulations shall be enforced in addition to the other normal restrictions on the day, which are not repugnant to the above.

India Today Best City Awards 2014: 
Kolkata bags top honour for crime and safety 

It is our proud privilege to share with you that Kolkata has been awarded the best city in the category of crime and safety. This award was presented at the second edition of the India today best city awards 2014 in New Delhi. The award was given after rigorous survey of various cities in India by the India Today group. 
  The second edition of India Today’s “Best City’s of India” of India report studied 30 capitals and metro cities and 20 emerging cities on 12 parameters. Our Kolkata emerged as safest city in the country.
While it has been the endeavaour of Kolkata police to serve its people in the best possible way, the credit should also go to the people of the city which has made Kolkata to achieve this status. Rightly so, we dedicate this award to the people of Kolkata.

T R A F F I C      R E G U L A T I O N S

No. : TP/48       Dated : 10.11.2014

      Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the public in connection with the 4th One Day International (Day & Night) Cricket match between India and Sri Lanka at Eden Gardens, Kolkata on 13.11.2014, I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of powers vested in me under Section 115, 117, 122 and 126 M V Act, 1988  and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act./ 39, 39(1b) of Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 and 93 of Rules for the Regulations of Traffic in Kolkata and its suburbs and under sub-section(1) of Section 4 of the West Bengal Traffic Regulations Act, 1965 (W B Act XV of 1965) read with Govt. of West Bengal Home (Transport) Department Order No. 7605-WT, dated the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT/3M-34/99, dated the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all classes of vehicles and all kinds of traffic including pedestrian traffic for the city of Kolkata shall be regulated in the manner prescribed below, notwithstanding any other orders in force on the day.

1)    Movement of all types of Goods Vehicles shall be temporarily restricted / suspended and / or diverted from the roads or road stretches at and around Eden Gardens, Maidan, AJC Bose Road between D L Khan Road and Hastings crossing, Belvedere Road, St. Georges Gate Road and Strand Road from 09.00 hours to 23.00 hrs on 13.11.2014, in addition to the normal restriction. 

 Movements of all types of Goods Vehicles shall be restricted to ply in and around Victoria Memorial Hall, i.e Portion of AJC Bose Road between D. L. Khan Road to Cathedral Road, Hospital Road, Queen way, Cathedral Road, Casuarina Avenue, Lovers Lane etc.

2)    Auckland Road, North Brooke Avenue and Kingsway will be closed to all types of vehicles, High Court bound cars will be allowed to move along Esplanade Row West, instead of Auckland Road and North Brooke Avenue, as and when considered necessary by Traffic Police on duty.

3)    Parking of vehicles will be prohibited on both sides of the following roads as and when considered necessary by the Traffic Police on duty :-
      
a)   Kingsway.
        b)   Auckland Road.
        c)   Govt. Place East.
        d)   Rani Rashmoni Avenue.
        e)   Old Court House Street.
        f)   Red Road.
        g)   Mayo Road.
        h)   Dufferin Road.
 i) Belvedere Road
 j) AJC Bose Road between D L Khan Road and Hastings crossing.
 
4)    Buses and Mini Buses coming from South Kolkata will be diverted (i) from Mayo Road towards Netaji Statue, Govt. Place East, Old Court House Street, B B D Bag and also (ii) from J L Nehru Road towards Bentinck Street, Mission Row, Mangoe Lane, B B D Bag, depending on the volume of traffic or as and when considered necessary by the Police on duty.
    
Similarly, Buses and Mini Buses from North and East Kolkata will be diverted (i) from Central Avenue towards Ganesh Ch. Avenue, Mangoe Lane, B B D Bag, (ii) from S N Banerjee Road towards R R Avenue, Govt  Place East, Old Court House Street, B B D Bag for westward journey and also (iii) from Old Court House Street towards Esplanade Row East, J L Nehru Road for southward journey as and when considered necessary by Police on duty.

5)    Motorists from south Kolkata may avail A J C Bose Road, St. Georges Gate Road, Strand Road and find access to B B D Bag area through Kiran Sankar Roy Road towards Council House Street according to the direction of traffic police on duty.
 
     Similarly, motorists from north and east Kolkata will enter B B D Bag area through B B Ganguly Street and also from S N Banerjee Road, R R Avenue, Govt. Place East, Old Court House Street etc. as directed by traffic police on duty.

6) Howrah Bound Buses & Mini Buses coming from South and South West Kolkata along D H Road, Khidderpore Bridge – Khidderpore Road will be diverted from Hastings crossing via St. Georges Gate Road – Strand Road – for their northward journey, as and when required.

8) Howrah Bound Buses & Mini Buses coming from South Kolkata along AJC Bose Road – J L Nehru Road – Mayo Road will be diverted from J L Nehru Road / Mayo Road crossing via Mayo Road -Dufferin Road – Khidderpore Road – Ghorapath – St Georges Gate Road – Strand Road – for their northward journey, as and when required.

(A) Green  Stickers   (Opposite Club House). 

i) From Howrah  : Brabourne Road – B B D Bag East – Old Court House Street – R. R. Avenue – Plassey Gate Road  - Parking Lots.  
ii) From North, Central and East Kolkata.  : C. R. Avenue – S. N. Banerjee Road – J. L. Nehru Road – R. R. Avenue - Parking Lot.    
iii) From South Kolkata : Mayo Road – Red Road – R. R. Avenue – Plassey Gate Road -  Parking Lot.   
 
(B)       Yellow Stickers (West & South of Mohun Bagan Ground and beside Vijay Smarak)

i) From Howrah  : Brabourne Rd. - BBD Bag East  - B. B. D. Bag  South - Hare Street - Strand Rd.- Kingsway - Parking lot.
ii) From North Central & East Kolkata : C. R. Avenue - G. C. Avenue -Mangoe Lane – B B D Bag South - Hare Street -Strand Road - Kingsway - Parking lot.

11)   Parking for TWO WHEELERS will be provided at the following locations by the police on duty subject to availability of space :
    
    a)   South of Md. Sporting Ground.
        b)   Strand Road near Band Stand.

12)   CARS WITHOUT STICKERS will be accommodated at Rangers Club Ground on a `first come first served' basis. 
       
13)   NO PARKING SPACE WILL BE ALLOWED FOR TAXIES, PRIVATE BUSES ETC.

14)   Bus stand at Band Stand and Auckland Road will be shifted to Kiran Shankar Roy Road and Esplanade Row East, Central Bus Terminus on the day.

15)   In order to ensure uninterrupted flow of traffic, Tram Services, in the BBD Bag, Esplanade, Old Court House Street, B B Ganguly Street and Maidan areas will be regulated as and when considered necessary by the traffic police on duty.

16)   Vehicular traffic may also be diverted from any of the arterial and feeder roads by traffic police on duty as and when considered necessary in the interest of the public on the day.

17)   These regulations will remain in force in addition to the other normal restrictions on the day, which are not repugnant to above.

        
          Sd/- S Kar Purkayastha

T R A F F I C R E G U L A T I O N S
No. : TP/45 Dated : 22.10.2014
Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the
public to regulate traffic of all kinds during the CHHAT PUJA Festival on 29.10.2014 and 30.10.2014,
I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of the powers vested in
me under Section 115, 117, 122 & 126 M V Act. 1988 and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act. /
39, 39(1b) of Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 & 93 of Rules for the
Regulations of Traffic in Calcutta and Suburbs and under sub-sec.(1) of Section 4 of West Bengal
Traffic Regulation Act, 1965 (W B Act XV of 1965) read with Govt. of West Bengal Home (Transport)
Department Order No.7605-WT dated the 20th July, 1965, and Govt. of West Bengal Transport
Department Notification No. 3363-WT/3M-34/99, dt. the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all
classes of vehicles and all kinds of traffic including the pedestrian traffic to the following areas and
all the following thoroughfares or portions thereof shall be regulated in the manner prescribed below
from 12.00 hrs to 22.00 hrs on 29.10.2014 and 03.00 hrs to 12.00 hrs on 30.10.2014.
1) Movement of carts of all descriptions and non-motorized vehicles will be temporarily
suspended from all the arterial roads on the approach of different bathing Ghats including Rani
Rashmoni Avenue, Govt. Place East, Gosthapal Sarani, Govt. Place West, Kshudiram Bose Road,
Strand Road, Nimtala Ghat Street, Bagbazar Street, Mullick Ghat Street, Jagannath Ghat Street, Dai
Ghat, Beadon Street, Strand Bank Road, B K Paul Avenue, Ahiritala Street, Sovabazar Street, G S
Bose Road, Banamali Naskar Road, Kusthia Road, Jheel Road, etc.
Movements of all types of Goods Vehicle including Chhat Puja connected goods vehicles shall
be restricted to ply in and around Victoria Memorial Hall, i.e. portion of AJC Bose Rd between D L
Khan Rd to Cathedral Road, Hospital Road, Queensway, Cathedral Road, Casuarina Avenue, Lovers
Lane, etc.
2) Movement of Goods Vehicles, not connected with Chhat Puja, shall be prohibited within the city
of Kolkata from 12.00 hours to 22.00 hours on 29.10.2014 and again from 03.00 hours to 10.00 hours
on 30.10.2014.
Movement of Goods Vehicles along the following lorry corridors (24 hours corridor) will also be
prohibited during the aforesaid time on 29.10.2014 and 30.10.2014.
(i) Bhukailash Road.
(ii) Circular Garden Reach Road
(iii) Clyde Road.
(iv) Commissariate Road.
(v) Durga Charan Banerjee Road.
(vi) Garden Reach Road.
(vii) Maharshi Debendra Road.
(viii) Napier Road.
(ix) Nimtala Ghat Street.
(x) Strand Road.
(xi) Strand Bank Road.
(xii) Sovabazar Street.
However, the roads may be opened for light commercial vehicles from 20.00 hrs. on
29.10.2014 to 03.00 hrs. on 30.10.2014 as usual on the days.
3) No vehicles shall be allowed to park or embark or disembark any person and load or unload on
the following roads / streets and thoroughfares from 12.00 hrs to 20.00 hrs on 29.10.2014 and again
from 03.00 hrs to 10.00 hrs on 30.10.2014.
(i) Dufferin Road.
(ii) Beadon Street.
(iii) Esplanade Row West.
(iv) Esplanade Row East.
(v) Mayo Road.
(vi) Govt. Place West
(vii) Kingsway.

(ix) Red Road.

Street, etc.

On 29th October, 2014 at about 14.00 hrs a Alam procession from 6H, Samsul Huda Road. Route:- Samsul Huda Road - Beck Bagan Row - AJC Bose Road - Mullick Bazar - Park Street - 7 Point Xing - Syed Amir Ali Avenue - Beck Bagan Row - Samsul Huda Road. Expected strength - 2000/2500.

T R A F F I C       R E G U L A T I O N S

          Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the public                     in connection with the MUHARRAM on and from 29.10.2014 (4th day) to 04.11.2014 (10th day),                      I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of powers vested in me under Section 115, 117, 122 and 126 M V Act, 1988 and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act./ 39, 39(1b) of  Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 and 93 of Rules for the Regulations of Traffic in Kolkata and its suburbs and   under sub-section(1) of Section 4 of the West Bengal Traffic Regulations Act, 1965 (W B Act XV of 1965) read with Govt. of West Bengal Home (Transport) Department Order No. 7605-WT, dated the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT / 3M- 34/99, dated the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all classes of vehicles and all kinds of traffic including pedestrian traffic to the following areas and all the following thoroughfares or portions thereof shall be regulated in the manner prescribed below, notwithstanding any other orders in force on those days. (Subject to the visibility of moon).

H)        Akhra processions from Metiabruz will be taken out on the 5th, 7th, 9th and 10th days of Muharram and will follow G R Road, Akra Road, along Akra Road to Karbala Road to Pond where they ended. All processions will follow this route.

          VEHICLES CARRYING KHICHURI AND/OR MUHARRAM REVELLERS WILL NOT BE ALLOWED ENTRY THROUGH HARI MOHAN GHOSH ROAD, PAHARPUR ROAD. HOWEVER, PROPERTY LINE VEHICLES AND ROUTE BUSES WILL BE ALLOWED. BUSES WILL TERMINATE NEAR MUDIALI ON PAHARPUR ROAD AND PROPERTY LINE VEHICLES WILL BE ALLOWED TO MOVE UPTO PISON CINEMA HALL ONLY ON 10TH DAY BETWEEN 05.00 HRS AND 14.00 HRS OR WHENEVER THE POLICE ON DUTY DIRECT WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. NO VEHICLE WILL PLY ALONG PAHARPUR ROAD BEYOND 14.00 HRS. (OR EARLIER) TILL ALL THE AKHRA PROCESSIONS ENTER TO THEIR DESTINATION.

I)     Parking of vehicles shall not be allowed along the roads/stretches of the processions during their movement as mentioned in Para-A to G herein above.

J)      i) Movement of all types of goods vehicles, carrying goods, including  all types of vehicles carrying LPG cylinders and petroleum products shall be temporarily restricted/suspended and/or diverted  within the city of Kolkata (KP’s jurisdiction) during the time of movement of  Muharram  processions  on all the days between 4th day and 8th day of Muharram from 29.10.2014 to 02.11.2014 (both days included) upto 01.00 hrs, in addition to the normal restrictions, or the termination of the processions which one is earlier after taken clearance from Traffic Control Room. 

 On 9th Day of Muharram (03.11.2014) up to 03.00 hrs, in addition to the normal restrictions, or the termination of the processions which one is earlier after taken clearance from Traffic Control Room. 
 
         ii) Heavy goods vehicles, medium goods vehicles and light motor vehicles, carrying goods, including all types of vehicles carrying LPG cylinders and petroleum products will not find entry / exit especially on the goods vehicle corridors in Central Business District and Kolkata Dock System and eastern corridor at the time of movement of the Muharram processions on the 10th day of Muharram  (04.11.2014) from 05.00 hrs to 05.00 hrs next day (05.11.2014), in addition to the normal restrictions, or the termination of the processions which one is earlier after taken clearance from Traffic Control Room.

K)    All types of vehicles may also be diverted from any of the arterial and / or feeder roads by the traffic police on duty, as and when considered necessary on and from 4th day to 10th day (i.e. 29.10.2014 to 04.11.2014) of Muharram.

L)     THESE REGULATIONS SHALL BE ENFORCED IN ADDITION TO THE OTHER NORMAL RESTRICTIONS ON THOSE DAYS, WHICH ARE NOT REPUGNANT TO ABOVE.

T R A F F I C      R E G U L A T I O N S

      Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the public in connection with the 5th One Day International (Day & Night) Cricket match between India and West Indies at Eden Gardens, Kolkata on 20.10.2014, I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of powers vested in me under Section 115, 117, 122 and 126 M V Act, 1988  and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act./ 39, 39(1b) of Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 and 93 of Rules for the Regulations of Traffic in Kolkata and its suburbs and under sub-section(1) of Section 4 of the West Bengal Traffic Regulations Act, 1965 (W B Act XV of 1965) read with Govt. of West Bengal Home (Transport) Department Order No. 7605-WT, dated the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT/3M-34/99, dated the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all classes of vehicles and all kinds of traffic including pedestrian traffic for the city of Kolkata shall be regulated in the manner prescribed below, notwithstanding any other orders in force on the day.

1)    Movement of all types of Goods Vehicles shall be temporarily restricted / suspended and / or diverted from the roads or road stretches at and around Eden Gardens, Maidan, AJC Bose Road between D L Khan Road and Hastings crossing, Belvedere Road, St. Georges Gate Road and Strand Road from 09.00 hours to 23.00 hrs on 20.10.2014, in addition to the normal restriction. 

 Movements of all types of Goods Vehicles shall be restricted to ply in and around Victoria Memorial Hall, i.e Portion of AJC Bose Road between D. L. Khan Road to Cathedral Road, Hospital Road, Queen way, Cathedral Road, Casuarina Avenue, Lovers Lane etc.

2)    Auckland Road, North Brooke Avenue and Kingsway will be closed to all types of vehicles, High Court bound cars will be allowed to move along Esplanade Row West, instead of Auckland Road and North Brooke Avenue, as and when considered necessary by Traffic Police on duty.

3)    Parking of vehicles will be prohibited on both sides of the following roads as and when considered necessary by the Traffic Police on duty :-
      
a)   Kingsway.
        b)   Auckland Road.
        c)   Govt. Place East.
        d)   Rani Rashmoni Avenue.
        e)   Old Court House Street.
        f)   Red Road.
        g)   Mayo Road.
        h)   Dufferin Road.
 i) Belvedere Road
 j) AJC Bose Road between D L Khan Road and Hastings crossing.
 
4)    Buses and Mini Buses coming from South Kolkata will be diverted (i) from Mayo Road towards Netaji Statue, Govt. Place East, Old Court House Street, B B D Bag and also (ii) from J L Nehru Road towards Bentinck Street, Mission Row, Mangoe Lane, B B D Bag, depending on the volume of traffic or as and when considered necessary by the Police on duty.
    
Similarly, Buses and Mini Buses from North and East Kolkata will be diverted (i) from Central Avenue towards Ganesh Ch. Avenue, Mangoe Lane, B B D Bag, (ii) from S N Banerjee Road towards R R Avenue, Govt  Place East, Old Court House Street, B B D Bag for westward journey and also (iii) from Old Court House Street towards Esplanade Row East, J L Nehru Road for southward journey as and when considered necessary by Police on duty.

5)    Motorists from south Kolkata may avail A J C Bose Road, St. Georges Gate Road, Strand Road and find access to B B D Bag area through Kiran Sankar Roy Road towards Council House Street according to the direction of traffic police on duty.
 
     Similarly, motorists from north and east Kolkata will enter B B D Bag area through B B Ganguly Street and also from S N Banerjee Road, R R Avenue, Govt. Place East, Old Court House Street etc. as directed by traffic police on duty.

6) Howrah Bound Buses & Mini Buses coming from South and South West Kolkata along D H Road, Khidderpore Bridge – Khidderpore Road will be diverted from Hastings crossing via St. Georges Gate Road – Strand Road – for their northward journey, as and when required.

8) Howrah Bound Buses & Mini Buses coming from South Kolkata along AJC Bose Road – J L Nehru Road – Mayo Road will be diverted from J L Nehru Road / Mayo Road crossing via Mayo Road -Dufferin Road – Khidderpore Road – Ghorapath – St Georges Gate Road – Strand Road – for their northward journey, as and when required.

9) Howrah Bound Buses & Mini Buses coming from North and East Kolkata along B B Ganguly Street – B B D Bag South – Hare Street – Strand Road will be diverted from the crossing of B B Ganguly Street / C R Avenue via C R Avenue – M G Road – Strand Road – Howrah Bridge Approach – Howrah, as and when required.

10)    Parking arrangements have been provided at the following five locations. Parking at these locations will be against Car Park Stickers as follows: -

(C)       Pink  Stickers   (North of Md. Sporting Ground behind Cenotaph).  
 
i) From Howrah  : Brabourne Rd. - BBD Bag East - Old Court House  St. - R. R. Avenue – Guru Nanak Sarani - Dufferin Rd. - J.K.Island - Red Rd. Cenotaph - Parking lot.    
ii) From North, Central and East Kolkata : C. R. Avenue - S. N. Banerjee Rd. - J. L. Nehru Rd. - R. R. Avenue - Duffrien Rd. -  Red Rd. – Cenotaph -  Parking lot.  
iii) From South Kolkata : Red Rd. – Cenotaph - Parking lot.  

(D)       Blue  Stickers   (South of Basket Ball Ground).  

 i) From Howrah  :  Brabourne Rd. - BBD Bagh East - Old Court House St. -R. R. Avenue – Guru Nanak Sarani - Dufferin Rd. – J.K.Island Red Road – Basket ball Ground -Parking lots.   
ii) From North, Central and East Kolkata : C. R. Avenue - S. N. Banerjee Road - J. L. Nehru Rd. - R. R. Avenue - Duffrien Road – J. K. Island – Red Rd.- Basket Ball Ground - Parking lots.   
iii) From South Kolkata. : Red Road – Basket Ball Ground  - Parking lots.  

(E)       Red Stickers   (On Strand Road/ Band Stand).  

i) From Howrah  : Brabourne Rd. - BBD Bagh East/South - Hare St. - Strand Rd.-Parking lots.   
ii) From South Kolkata : AJC Bose Road - V. Setu Ramp – St. Georges Gate Rd.- Strand Rd. - Parking lots.   
iii) From North, Central and East Kolkata : C. R. Avenue - G. C. Avenue - Mangoe Lane – B B D Bagh South - Hare St. - Strand Rd. - Parking lots.

11)   Parking for TWO WHEELERS will be provided at the following locations by the police on duty subject to availability of space :
    
    a)   South of Md. Sporting Ground.
        b)   Strand Road near Band Stand.

12)   CARS WITHOUT STICKERS will be accommodated at Rangers Club Ground on a `first come first served' basis. 
       
13)   NO PARKING SPACE WILL BE ALLOWED FOR TAXIES, PRIVATE BUSES ETC.

14)   Bus stand at Band Stand and Auckland Road will be shifted to Kiran Shankar Roy Road and Esplanade Row East, Central Bus Terminus on the day.

15)   In order to ensure uninterrupted flow of traffic, Tram Services, in the BBD Bag, Esplanade, Old Court House Street, B B Ganguly Street and Maidan areas will be regulated as and when considered necessary by the traffic police on duty.

16)   Vehicular traffic may also be diverted from any of the arterial and feeder roads by traffic police on duty as and when considered necessary in the interest of the public on the day.

17)   These regulations will remain in force in addition to the other normal restrictions on the day, which are not repugnant to above.

        
                                         Sd/- S Kar Purkayastha               
Dated, the 13th             Commissioner of Police
October, 2014  Kolkata

On 9th October 2014 at about 13.00 hrs a rally/procession from College Square to “R.R. Avenue” along College Street – Niirmal Chandra Street – Rafi Ahmed Kidwai Road - S. N. Banerjee Road – Dorina crossing and terminate at R.R. Avenue. Expected strength - 400/500.

Sharing a few snaps of the real nervecentre of the city traffic dynamics during the incredibly challenging Puja days. .Our Traffic Control Room. ..where a bunch of tremendously dedicated officers slog it out round - the - clock and coordinate with our men on the streets to keep the city moving. Regards from Team KTP.

Dear members,  it's been that time of the year again over the last six days. ...that demanding time of the year when every single member of Kolkata Traffic Police,  ranks and designations notwithstanding,  braces up for meeting the challenges of keeping our beloved city moving during the biggest festival of Bengal. Puja revelry this year commenced from Chaturthi itself and the seemingly endless stream of people and vehicles kept on multiplying over the next few days with every passing hour.

As in the years past,  we at KTP pulled out all the stops to put our best foot forward to meet the most demanding of challenges. We may have succeeded on some counts and may have fallen short on some. But we tried.  Wholeheartedly. With the belief that the reward of a job sincerely done is to have done it. As we prepare afresh for the immersion duties following a gruelling 18 hours  a day schedule for six days on the trot,  we extend our grateful thanks to the citizens of Kolkata for their unflinching support . Subho Vijaya.....Regards from Team KTP

T R A F F I C       R E G U L A T I O N S

 Whereas it is necessary for preventing danger, obstruction or inconvenience to the public to regulate traffic of all kinds during the Panchami on 29.09.2014 (Monday), the Sasthi on 30.09.2014 (Tuesday), the Saptami on 01.10.2014 (Wednesday), the Astami  on 02.10.2014 (Thursday), the Navami (03.10.2014) and during Durga Puja Immersion Days falling on 03.10.2014 (Dashami) (Friday), (if required), 04.10.2014 (Saturday) and 06.10.2014 (Monday) (after 20.00 hrs)  and again during the Lakshmi Puja Immersion falling on 08.10.2014 (Wednesday), I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata,  in exercise of the powers vested in me under Section 115, 117, 122 & 126  M.V.Act. 1988 and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act / 39, 39(1b) of Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 & 93 of Rules for the Regulations of Traffic in Kolkata and Suburbs and under sub-section(1)  of Section 4 of West Bengal Traffic Regulation Act, 1965 (W.B Act XV of 1965) read with Govt. of West Bengal Home (Transport) Department Order No.7605-WT, dt. the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT/3M-34/99, dt the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that all classes of vehicles and all kind of traffic including pedestrian traffic to the following areas  and  all  the  following  thoroughfares  or  portions  thereof  shall  be  regulated  in  the  manner  prescribed below :-

 (These additional regulations shall remain in force during the days and hours specified in this order. All previous orders issued in respect of the areas and the roads, streets and thoroughfares or portions thereof, which are repugnant to that mentioned below, shall remain suspended during the period.)

(IX) Route to Ghats  -

1) On Immersion days, route of Mysore Ghat, Keoratala Burning Ghats, Adi Ghat on the South of Hazra Road shall be via R.B. Avenue, Kalighat Road and Tollygunge Road.
2) On Immersion days, route to Ghats on Adi Ganga,  North of Hazra Road, shall be as follows :
Hazra Road, Harish Mukherjee Road, Balaram Bose Ghat Road, Harish Chatterjee Street and go out by Harish Chatterjee Street and Hazra Road.  

3) On Immersion days, vehicles carrying images shall proceed to the Ghats on the South Moorings (Strand Road) South of Gosthapal Sarani (Kingsway) via Gosthapal Sarani and Strand Road. After immersions the vehicles shall leave Strand Road towards South i.e. St. Georges Gate Road. 
Similarly vehicles carrying images shall proceed to Baza and Kadamtala Ghat on Strand Road from Ghothapal Sarani and after immersion the vehicles shall leave Strand Road towards North.
4) Vehicles carrying images bound for Jagannath Ghat shall move along Vivekananda Road, K. K. Tagore Street  and Cross Road No. 5.
5)  Image carrying vehicles should not be allowed to ply on AJC Bose Road Fly Over.
6) On Immersion days, route of Kumartuli Ghat on the North shall be via Jatindra Mohan Avenue, Madan Mohan Tala Street, Rabindra Sarani, Durga Charan Banerjee Street, Strand Bank Road.
7) On Immersion days, route of Sovabazar Ghat, Ahiritola Ghat on the North shall be via Jatindra Mohan Avenue, B K Pal Avenue, Nimtala Ghat Street, Maharshi Debendra Road, Ahiritola Street, Strand Bank Road.
8) On Immersion days, route of Nimtala Ghat on the North shall be via Jatindra Mohan Avenue, B K Pal Avenue, Nimtala Ghat Street, Strand Bank Road. 
From East and Central Kolkata for Nimtala Ghat, Ahiritola Ghat, Sovabazar Ghat shall be via C R Avenue, J M Avenue, Beadon Street, Nimtala Ghat Street, Strand Bank Road.

1) Harish Chatterjee Street shall be “One Way” from North to South.
2) Balaram Bose Ghat Road shall be “One Way” from East to West.

5) Beadon Street shall be “One Way” from East to West.
6) Nimtala Ghat Street shall be “One Way” from East to West.

9) Ratan Babu Road shall be “One Way” from East to West.

15) No immersion procession will be allowed to come towards Parnashree Jheel from North West Corner of the Pond, they will be diverted to take Banamali Naskar Road / Upen Banerjee Road thence to the Eastern side – Northern side – Western side- for dispersal. No Vehicular traffic will be allowed in the immersion route.
16) Strand Road between Cross Road V to Nimtala Ghat Street shall be “One Way” from North to South.
  

(XI) 1)    Tram Cars and Buses on Bidhan Sarani, College Street and Rabindra Sarani shall be suspended from 15:00 hrs. onwards, as and when considered necessary by the police on duty.
 2)    North bound Buses along Bidhan Sarani shall be diverted via Vivekananda  Road and APC Roy Road to the terminus and South bound Buses  shall  be  diverted from Shyambazar 5 point crossing along APC Roy Road and Vivekananda Road according  to the direction of the police on duty.
 3)   Buses of suburban routes now having terminus on Strand Road and Eden Gardens, Band Stand shall be shifted to Kiran Sankar Roy Road on 04.10.2014, 06.10.2014 and 08.10.2014  from  13:00 hrs. to  04:00 hrs.  Likewise, the Buses having terminus on  Kshudiram Bose Road shall also be shifted to the aforesaid road on the aforesaid dates and times.
        On those days, they shall  proceed via R R Avenue, Govt. Place East,  B.B.D Bag (South),  Hare Street, Strand  Road and terminate on Kiran Sankar Roy Road.During the return journey,  those buses shall move along  Strand Road,  Fairlie Place, around  B.B.D Bag,  Old Court House Street,  Govt. Place East and then take normal route.
 4)    Up and Down journeys of Bus route no. 15 shall be via Howrah Bridge Approach Road, M.G.Road,  C.R.Avenue,  Vivekananda Road,  APC Roy Road to destination. Up and Down  journeys of Bus route no.11 and 11A shall be via Howrah Bridge,  M. G. Road,  Rabindra Sarani, Vivekananda Road and APC Roy Road to and from Howrah.

(XII) This year Navami and Dashami falls on the same day i.e. on 03.10.2014 and also the 1st day of Immersion. Therefore these Regulations may be changed as and when considered necessary on the day (03.10.2014) keeping in view of the above object.

(XIII)   Buses plying along Paharpur Road will be diverted along Taratala Road and Garden Reach Road from 15:00 hrs. and till such time the police considers it necessary on and from 29.09.2014 to 04.10.2014, 06.10.2014 and on 08.10.2014 everyday. 

 Movements of Buses will also be restricted along Garden Reach Road and will either terminate at Ramnagar crossing or Kanchi Sarak from 15:00 hrs. on 03.10.2014 (if required), 04.10.2014, 06.10.2014 and 08.10.2014 in view of immersions at Bichalighat.

(XIV) VEHICULAR TRAFFIC MAY ALSO BE DIVERTED FROM ANY OF THE ARTERIAL AND FEEDER ROADS BY TRAFFIC POLICE ON DUTY AS AND WHEN CONSIDERED NECESSARY IN THE INTEREST OF THE PUBLIC ON 29.09.2014, 30.09.2014, 01.10.2014, 02.10.2014, 03.10.2014, 04.10.2014, 06.10.2014 AND 08.10.2014. 

(XV)  PEDESTRIAN TRAFFIC MAY BE REGULATED FROM ANY OF THE ROADS/ STREETS AND THOROUGHFARES WITHIN THE CITY BY POLICE ON DUTY AS THE SITUATION DEMANDS ON 29.09.2014, 30.09.2014, 01.10.2014, 02.10.2014, 03.10.2014, 04.10.2014, 06.10.2014 AND 08.10.2014.

(XVI) These regulations shall be enforced in addition to the other normal restrictions on those days, which are not repugnant to above.

Sharing some snapshots of our sustained drive against unruly/errant/indisciplined auto rickshaws in the city. Erring/reckless drivers were instantly intercepted and consequently penalised for flouting traffic rules. Pertinent to reiterate that our vigilant officers maintain zero tolerance measures & enforce stringent prosecution  strictly in accordance with law whenever instances of infringement are detected. Numerous prosecutions were enforced for plethora of offences ranging from R/C violation, unauthorised parking, misbehaviour, plying on truncated routes, overcharging etc. KTP officers are committed to sustain such crackdowns with greater intensity in future too for ensuring the greater interest & convenience of the esteemed citizens at large. Thanks & regards, team KTP.

Here are a few snapshots depicting the sustained effort put in by our  officers against  the menace of taxi refusals, misbehavior, overcharging, plying shuttle/truncated route  etc. Crackdowns/Raids are conducted on a daily basis in every nook and corner of the city , to bolster our endeavour we have identified some of the vulnerable& violation prone stretches of the city and focused  our concerted efforts therein. Stringent enforcement  through prosecution strictly in adherence to rules are made whenever contravention is detected to have deterrence. It shall also be imperative to mention that plain clothed police personnel masquerading as passengers  contributed in a significant manner too  to nab errant drivers , culminating in a plethora of prosecution cases registered against multifarious offences ranging from R/C violation, to misbehavior, refusals, overcharging, plying shuttle etc. KTP is aware that such drives have to be sustained with greater intensity in future too and officers are committed & relentlessly striving to render more exquisite service to the esteemed citizens of the city . Zero tolerance  measures are adopted to rein in rogue/reckless drivers so as to  eradicate the menace in its totality. Sharing  some of the random snapshots which are taken during our drive last week wherein  a team of handpicked officers are seen  conducting drives against errant  taxis. Regards, team KTP.

Inviting kind attention of the esteemed members of this page. The Facebook page of Kolkata Traffic Police now boasts of a membership of close to 55,000 of well-wishing citizens. The rate of growth in membership has been very encouraging and active participation of the citizens has helped this page evolve into an effective enforcement tool on one hand, and a medium for meaningful self-introspection and development on the other. Some of the members may be aware that with a view to making the platform more participatory and the interaction a little more structured, we had organised three sessions of ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' over the last two years and a half wherein around 150/160 members had face-to-face interactions with senior officers of Kolkata Traffic Police at Lalbazar, the Kolkata Police Headquarters. The idea was to have a frank and no-holds barred exchange of views and find ways to improve traffic management in this beloved city of ours. The first three sessions witnessed overwhelming response and many useful suggestions came from members which were duly implemented.

We propose to hold the forth session of ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' on Saturday, 02.08.2014 at Lalbazar at 03:30 PM. Since sparing time on weekdays would obviously be difficult for the members, the interaction, as on the last three occasions, has been scheduled on a Saturday. Would humbly request members willing to participate to share their address and phone numbers/e-mail id latest within 19.07.2014 so that we can send official invitations in advance. The number of members we can accommodate is a maximum of 100 and hence priority will have to be accorded to those who confirm their participation early. Please also indicate your mode of conveyance so that we can make necessary parking arrangements. For any further queries, you may post/mail on/to the KTP FB page or contact Insp. Tridip Datta (9830449956/octcc@kolkatatrafficpolice.gov.in) or Insp. Nilesh Choudhury (98302-44145/nilesh1304@gmail.com) or Sgt Sudipto Mukherjee (98368-63377/sudipto.pri@gmail.com) or Sgt Indrajit Dutta (9830052765/indrajitdutta@live.in).

The support of the citizens, we have always maintained, is our principal source of sustenance and we hope this venture of ours would also be blessed with your support and encouragement. Let us all work together for a ''faster, safer, friendlier'' Kolkata.

Thanks and warm regards from Team KTP

S.Biswas, since you had indeed contravened the provision of law by violating traffic signal at Parama Island on the mentioned  date at the stipulated time. T R A F F I C     R E G U L A T I O N S
-------------------------------------------------------------------

No.: TP/21                                                        Dated : 02.05.2014 

Where as it is necessary in the interest of public safety and convenience in connection with the General Election to the 16th Lok Sabha, 2014, I, Surajit Kar Purkayastha, Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, in exercise of powers vested upon me under Section 115, 117, 122 and 126 of M V Act, 1988 and Section 62, 62(1b) of Calcutta Police Act. / 39, 39(1b) of Calcutta Suburban Police Act read with Rule No. 85, 86, 87, 88 and 93 of Rules for the Regulation of Traffic in Kolkata and its suburbs and under sub-section(1) of Section 4 of the West Bengal Traffic Regulations Act, 1965 (W B Act XV of 1965) read with Govt. of West Bengal Home (Transport) Department Order No. 7605-WT, dated the 20th July, 1965 and Govt. of West Bengal Transport Department Notification No. 3363-WT/3M-34/99, dated the 29th April, 1999, do hereby order that movement of vehicles for the city of Kolkata shall be regulated in the manner prescribed below, notwithstanding any other orders in force on 11.05.2014, 12.05.2014 and 16.05.2014.

A) Movement of all types of Goods Vehicles, except those connected with Election process, shall be restricted to ply within the city of Kolkata in between 05.00 hours and 20.00 hours on 12.05.2014.

B)    Movement of all types of vehicles including election vehicles will be regulated in the following manner as and when considered necessary by the traffic police on duty on 11.05.2014, 12.05.2014 and 16.05.2014.

i) West bound vehicles (Small vehicle) of Auckland Road (except vehicles of High Court and Election Commission) will be diverted further north from AIR along Govt. Place (West) and buses will be diverted further west from C R Das’s Statue along Kingsway. East bound small vehicles of Auckland Road will be diverted further north along Strand Road from Auckland Road crossing and east bound buses will be diverted via Kingsway.

ii) East bound vehicles of Mayurbhanj Road may be diverted from Bhukailash Road crossing towards south to avail Hossain Shah Road/Remount Road.

iii) North bound vehicles of Meher Ali Mondal Street may be closed from Mominpore Road crossing. East bound vehicles of Meher Ali Mondal Street may be diverted towards south.

iv) East bound vehicles along Judges Court Road will be diverted through South and North along Alipore Road from Alipore Road, Judges Court Road, if required.

v) West bound vehicles along Judges Court Road will be diverted towards North along Baker Road from Gopal Nagar crossing after making Baker Road both way as and when considered necessary.

vi) Election vehicles for Hastings House will enter from Alipore Road and exit through Judges Court Road.

vii) If required, Hastings Park Road will be closed for vehicular traffic, except property line vehicles.

viii) West bound traffic (small vehicle) along Hazra Road and Judges Court Road will be diverted towards South, Rakhal Das Auddy Road as and when considered necessary.

ix) Beltola Road will be closed for vehicular traffic from Sarat Bose Road towards east. 

x) Paddamapukur Road will remain One Way from West to East from Sarat Bose Road as and when considered necessary.

xi) Love Lock Place will remain One Way from East to West from Ballygunge Circular Road to Beltala Road.

xii) Palit Street will remain One Way from West to East.

xiii) Ritchi Road will remain One Way from North to South.

xiv) West bound vehicles of Ballygunge Circular Road may be restricted from Ballygunge Phari.

1

xv) Paddamapukur Road will remain one way from West to East in between Ballygunge Circular Road and Ballygunge Govt. School and no vehicle will be allowed to enter Beltala Road from Sarat Bose Road crossing towards east and from Puddapukur Road towards west as and when considered necessary.

xvi) North bound vehicles along Ritchi Road may be closed from Palit Street crossing as and when considered necessary.

xvii) West bound vehicles of Ballygunge Circular Road may be closed from Ashutosh Chowdhury Avenue crossing or Gurusaday Dutta Road crossing as and when considered necessary.

xviii) North bound vehicles of D H Road may be diverted from the crossing of Ekbalpore Road towards Strandel Road and South bound vehicles of D H Road may be diverted from Hastings crossing as and when considered necessary.

xix) Judges Court Road will remain close to vehicular traffic from Gopal Nagar More to Alipore Road crossing on the Counting day (16.05.2014).

xx) Election vehicles (Buses) will be parked on B T Road western side from opp. Birla Institute of Technology upto Main Gate of Rabindra Bharati University, single line parallel to the kerb.

xxi) Election vehicles (Mini Buses) will be parked on B T Road western side from Main Gate of Rabindra Bharati University towards north, single line parallel to the kerb.

xxii) Lord Sinha Road may be closed for vehicular traffic as and when considered necessary, except election/property line vehicles.

xxiii) Bijoygarh Main Road may be made One Way from north to south, except election vehicles.

xxiv) Rajdanga Main Road may be made One Way from west to east.

C) Vehicular traffic on the following roads/streets may be diverted/regulated as and when considered necessary by the traffic police on duty on 11.05.2014, 12.05.2014 and 16.05.2014.

i) Near 56, B.T. Road
ii) Near Hastings House on Judges Court Road.
iii) 38/2, Beltala Road.
iv) Belvedere Road
v) Hastings Park Road
vi) Judges Court Road between Alipore Road and Kalighat Bridge.
vii) Ballygunge Circular Road
viii) Lovelock Place
ix) Mayurbhanj Road and Bhukailash Road
x) D H Road from Ekbalpore crossing and Khidderpore Road from Hastings crossing.

D)    No vehicle, except those connected with elections, will be allowed to park on the following roads as and when considered necessary by the traffic police on duty on 11.05.2014, 12.05.2014 and 16.05.2014.

i) Near 56, B.T. Road
ii) Near Hastings House on Judges Court Road
iii) 38/2, Beltala Road
iv) Belvedere Road
v) Hastings Park Road
vi) In case of inclement weather only, election vehicles will be allowed to park in single line along northern side of Judges Court Road and eastern side of Hastings Park Road.
vii) Lovelock Place (Both sides)
viii) Ballygunge Circular Road from AAEI to Ballygunge Phari (Both sides).
ix) Puddapukur Road from Sarat Bose Road to Ballygunge Circular Road (Both sides).
x) Beltola Road from Puddapukur Road to Sarat Bose Road (Both sides).
xi) Palit Street.
xii) Earl Street.
xiii) Balmiki Street.
xiv) Sarat Bose Road (western side) from Puddapukur Road to Beltola Road.
xv) Mayurbhanj Road
xvi) D H Road from Ekbalpore crossing to Khidderpore crossing.

2

xvii) Lord Sinha Road, both sides.
xviii) On J L Nehru Road in between Shakespeare Sarani and AJC Bose Road.
xix) Pretoria Street.
xx) Both side of the road from the crossing of Rash Behari Connector and Shanti Pally up to Delhi Public School (Ruby Park), eastern side of Gitanjali Stadium.
xxi) Both side of the road from the crossing of Rash Behari Connector and Rajdanga Main Road, western side of Gitanjali Stadium.
xxii) Judges Court Road from Alipore Road and Baker Road crossing.
xxiii) Camac Street eastern side from Short Street and Shakespeare Sarani.
xxiv) Strand Road western side opp. C & D Gate, Ganga Sagar Mela Complex and Band Stand.
xxv) Ballygunge Circular Road, western side from Love Lock Place to Puddapukur Road and the southern side of Ballygunge Circular Road from Ballygunge Science College to St. Lawrence School in single line.
xxvi) Love Lock Place eastern side, Sarat Bose Road western side from Beltola Road to Puddapukur, on Earl Street, Balmiki Street around Maddox Square
xxvii) Opposite side ground of Bijoygarh College, on the road in front of the College and inside Golf Green.
xxviii) Chakraborty Para Road northern side, end of Gitanjali Stadium crossing.

E) No vehicles, except election vehicles will be allowed to park near the vicinity of any Counting Centre on 16.05.2014.

F) Movement of Tram Services may be suspended along Diamond Harbour Road in between Khidderpore Road and Ekbalpore crossing from 08.00 hrs. on 11.05.2014 & from 18.00 hrs on 12.05.2014.
    
G)       If required, movement of Tram Cars along Judges Court Road may be suspended and / or restricted from 08.00 hrs. on 11.05.2014, from 18.00 hrs on 12.05.2014 and from 06.30 hrs on 16.05.2014.

H)        Vehicular traffic may also be diverted from any of the major / minor / arterial roads and feeder roads by the traffic police on duty as and when considered necessary on those days in public interest.
                                                                                                              
Dated : 02.05.2014.                                           (Surajit Kar Purkayastha)
                                          Commissioner of Police
                                           Kolkata

Introducing Kolkata Traffic Police Mobile App to facilitate android based cell phone users for instant uploading of traffic related views at KTP Facebook wall or mail to us. Social media and the use of technology are crucial for policing in the 21st century. In today’s online world the Kolkata Traffic Police Mobile App is a step to bridge the gap between our police force and our citizens to improve the overall traffic conditions and to ease the stress of day to day commuting in the streets of Kolkata.
The App offers citizens a quick and discrete method for reporting traffic related activity directly and instantaneously to Kolkata Police. Using this app, citizens can send the Police pictures, and text messages of traffic related activity which requires Police attention. The application allows citizens to either post the information on Kolkata Police Facebook page or e-mail it to Kolkata Police.

Citizens can report the following issues the App:
1. Traffic violations (speeding, rash driving, etc.)
2. Suspicious vehicles
3. Taxi refusal
4. Traffic congestion
5. Parking issues
6. Vehicles emitting pollution
7. Road accidents
8. Unlawful road blockades
9. Pedestrian problems
10. Road conditions
11. Commend a traffic officer
At present this App is available for Android phones only.

Kolkata Traffic Police has introduced an e-Payment system through Kolkata Traffic Police website (http://kolkatatrafficpolice.gov.in) for all types of cases registered under Kolkata Police Jurisdiction including Compound, Citation and Sticker Cases, to facilitate the stakeholders for instant payment and disposal of traffic violations. The initiative of Kolkata Traffic Police is a step to bridge the gap between our police force and our citizens to mitigate the lengthy manual process for the interest of public service. 
Thanks and regards.
Team KTP

Kolkata Traffic Police wishes Subho Bijaya to all the esteemed members of this page. Puja traffic management has always been the biggest annual challenge for us over the years. This year too, Team KTP has tried its level-best to live up to the challenge and made an all-out round-the-clock effort to keep the city traffic smooth and hassle-free during the Puja days of Sasthi to Navami. The seemingly endless waves of crowd coupled with the severely hostile weather on Ashtami and Navami made it all the more challenging for us this year. Whether  we have been able to meet the expectations or not... to what extent we could succeed and to what extent we could not...it is for the people of this beloved city of ours to judge. All we can humbly submit is that we tried our heart and soul to deliver. Feedback from the citizens about their puja traffic experience is most welcome. While your words of praise will bolster our spirit and make us feel that all the effort has been worth it, your criticism, needless to add, is also most welcome so that we can try to improve in the years to come.  As we gear up for immersion duties, we also take this opportunity to convey our grateful thanks to the citizens for extending their cooperation during the Pujas. Wishing Subho Bijaya to all once again from all members of Team Kolkata Traffic Police. 
Thanks and regards

Introducing Kolkata Traffic Police Mobile App to facilitate android based cell phone users for instant uploading of traffic related views at KTP Facebook wall or mail to us.  Social media and the use of technology are crucial for policing in the 21st century. In today’s online world the Kolkata Traffic Police Mobile App is a step to bridge the gap between our police force and our citizens to improve the overall traffic conditions and to ease the stress of day to day commuting in the streets of Kolkata.
The App offers citizens a quick and discrete method for reporting traffic related activity directly and instantaneously to Kolkata Police. Using this app, citizens can send the Police pictures, and text messages of traffic related activity which requires Police attention. The application allows citizens to either post the information on Kolkata Police Facebook page or e-mail it to Kolkata Police. 

Citizens can report the following issues the App:
1.	Traffic violations (speeding, rash driving, etc.)
2.	Suspicious vehicles
3.	Taxi refusal
4.	Traffic congestion
5.	Parking issues
6.	Vehicles emitting pollution
7.	Road accidents
8.	Unlawful road blockades

As Kolkata Traffic Police braces up to face its biggest annual challenge of Puja management after months of planning and preparation, we do appreciate that our efforts will not bear fruits without the whole-hearted cooperation of the esteemed citizens. Hence, with a view to bolster our endeavour to ensure a safe, secure and happy Puja for all, we launch a Road Safety Awareness campaign in the run-up to the festive days which seeks to capture the Puja spirit and in the same breath sends out a few basic traffic advisories. We are sure that we shall, as always, continue to receive the unflinching support of the citizens. Here are a few snapshots of the posters/banners/hoardings which will hit the streets today onwards. 
Thanks and regards from Team KTP

''No Honking Day'' will be observed on 9th September by Kolkata Traffic Police all over the city during the peak traffic hours of 10- 12 noon. We are privileged to have students of as many as 111 schools across the length and breadth of this beloved city of ours participating in the campaign. Hand in hand with KTP, schoolchildren will make a sincere effort to sensitize citizens about the dangers of sound pollution caused by unnecessary honking through placards, posters, banners in the vicinity of schools, hospitals and important crossings. While our anti-pollution cell and special raid section do hold raids against unnecessary honking on a regular basis, we are aware that as is the case with most traffic violations, mere enforcement is not the solution unless coupled with awareness campaigns . Hence in addition to our routine enforcement drives, we have sought the help of schoolchildren throughout the city to make the city motorists a little more aware and sensitive to the menace of sound pollution. Let us all join hands to make our city roads free from unnecessary honking. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Sharing a few snapshots of an one-day workshop for drivers, owners and attendants of poolcars and school buses organized by South East Traffic Guard under the leadership of Shri Alok Sanyal, OC, South East Traffic Guard on 28.07.2013 with a view to sensitizing them on the rules of the road, the safety measures needed to be exercised while driving poolcars and school buses and necessary soft skills. The response was overwhelming with an attendance close to 200 people. It was heartening to find representatives from the management of different school (South Point, Patha Bhavan, Carmel School, Nava Nalanda, Ballygunge Siksha Sadan, to name a few…) attend the session with keen enthusiasm. The idea was to sensitize all concerned about the safety of school children in the streets of Kolkata.
Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@ Tarun Gupta..............With reference to your Facebook complaint vide memo no. F/B- 908 dt. 02.07.13. We appreciate your awareness / concern but would like to inform you that the duration of traffic signal/ timer at the xing of prince Golam Mohd Shah & Uday Sankar Sarani is in day time North - South & West = 15 sec., North - South = 35 sec, East - West & North & South = 20 sec, West - East & South & North = 30 sec, all red 10 sec. But when VIP or VVIP movement is noticed  , signal is operated in  manual mode but at this juncture duration on times cycle does not exceed 2 minutes. Thanks.

@ Ratin Menon......... in response to your facebook complaint vide memo no. F/B- 963 dt. 10.07.13. We like to inform you that the breakup of signal cycle time of Parama Island are as following:-

06.00 to 22.00 hrs - South to North = 65 Sec.
                                 North to South & West = 50 Sec.
                                 West to East = 25 Sec.
                                 All red = 10 sec. 
                                 Total = 150 Sec.

            It is normally operated in automatic mode. But during pick hours if the volume of traffic suddenly increases (in day & evening both) then the automatic light signal mode is transferred into manual mode and the increased volume of traffic is released with preference and after normalization automatic is further started. 
           Further, about Jadavpur Thana signal, cycle timing (duration) of light signal at the crossing of PA Saha Road and Raja SC Mullick Road not more than 190 seconds as highest except VIP movement. Thanks.

Dear members, the response to our invitation to participate in the proposed Facebook Friends’ Forum on 13.07.2013 has been absolutely overwhelming. As we had mentioned in our earlier posts in this regard, we can accommodate a maximum of 70 members due to constraints of space and time. We are, therefore, unable to invite more than 70 willing members though many more have volunteered to participate. We have accorded preference to those who have not attended our earlier meetings and to those who have responded to our post the earliest. Formal invitations are being sent to 70 members through mail/phone to attend the forum on 13.07.2013 at 03.30 PM at Traffic Conference Room, Traffic Building, Lalbazar. Our men will be deployed in adequate numbers to facilitate your entry and parking. Our sincere apologies to all those whom we are unable to accommodate this time round.  Grateful thanks for your unflinching support. Regards from team KTP.

Inviting kind attention of the esteemed members of this page. The Facebook page of Kolkata Traffic Police now boasts of a membership of close to 37,000 of well-wishing citizens. The rate of growth in membership has been very encouraging and active participation of the citizens has helped this page evolve into an effective enforcement tool on one hand, and a medium for meaningful self-introspection and development on the other.Some of the members may be aware that with a view to making the platform more participatory and the interaction a little more structured, we had organised two sessions of ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' over the last year and a half wherein around 50/60 members had face-to-face interactions with senior officers of Kolkata Traffic Police at Lalbazar, the Kolkata Police Headquarters. The idea was to have a frank and no-holds barred exchange of views and find ways to improve traffic management in this beloved city of ours. The first two sessions witnessed overwhelming response and many useful suggestions came from members which were duly implemented.

We propose to hold the third session of ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' on Saturday, 13.7.2013 at Lalbazar at 3 30 PM. Since sparing time on weekdays would obviously be difficult for the members, the interaction, as on the last two occasions,has been scheduled on a Saturday. Would humbly request members willing to participate to share their address and phone numbers/e-mail id latest within 3.7.2013 so that we can send official invitations in advance. The number of members we can accommodate is a maximum of 70 and hence priority will have to be accorded to those who confirm their participation early. Please also indicate your mode of conveyance so that we can make necessary parking arrangements. For any further queries, you may post/mail on/to the KTP FB page or contact Sgt Nilesh Choudhury (98302-44145/nilesh1304@gmail.com) or Sgt Sudipto Mukherjee (98368-63377/sudipto.pri@gmail.com or occell@gmail.com ).

The support of the citizens,we have always maintained, is our principal source of sustenance and we hope this venture of ours would also be blessed with your support and encouragement. Let us all work together for a ''faster,safer,friendlier'' Kolkata.

Thanks and warm regards from Team KTP

Plain-clothed traffic personnel from the special raid team of KTP posing as passengers caught red-handed as many as 72 taxi-drivers during the act of refusals over the last two days. Here are a few snapshots of the raids. The drives have been continuing at least twice a week over the last six months at different refusal-prone stretches of the city and will continue in the days to come with greater intensity. Necessary legal actions ranging from prosecutions to temporary suspension of licenses have followed. As we have always maintained, the menace cannot be brought to an end overnight, but sustained efforts at enforcement shall surely improve things and we shall keep trying hard to bring about the same. Kindly post refusal-complaints on this page with details of taxi-number, date, time and place or call 1073/22143644. Thanks for your support. Regards from Team KTP.

Kolkata Traffic Police have been organising sensitisation workshops for taxi-drivers and auto-drivers all over the city for the past few months with special emphasis on soft skills, behavioural patterns, pollution norms and rules of the road.  The idea is to bring about an attitudinal change among the stakeholders of the streets of Kolkata alongside sustained enforcement. Things may not change overnight, but such workshops, we believe, will contribute to making our beloved city a better place to live in.  Sharing a few snapshots of the numerous workshops organised in the recent past by Kolkata Traffic Police.
Thanks and regards from Team KTP

Many members, residing in Behala area, have of late drawn our attention to the poor condition of Diamond Harbour Road which not only slows down traffic but also heightens the possibility of accidents.  A high-level meeting has been held this afternoon at the behest of KTP at Lalbazar, Kolkata Police Head Quarters with the utility agencies concerned so that the necessary repairs are done to the extent possible at the earliest.  The matter is being monitored from this end.  
Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@ Sayan Ghosh..................in reference to your facebook complaint vide memo no. F/B- 220 dt. 06.02.13. The ''One Way'' system of Traffic along the following Roads for better circulation of Traffic.
            The one way restrictions (the vehicular traffic will move in such direction) are as follows:- 
A) P K Muhkerjee Road - East bound
B) Manmotha Ganguly Street - East bound
C) Rai Charan Sadhukhan Road - South bound
D) Canal East Road - South bound
E) Canal West Road - North bound
F) Galiff Street - West bound.

  From the above this is clear that the vehicles coming from Kolkata Station intends to go towards North i.e. B T Road will have to take the left turn to Canal East Road through Gajnabi Bridge towards South then cross the Canal Bridge near Ultadanga Road to Canal West Road then move towards North cross R G Kar Road then Galiff Street towards West then take right turn to Tala Bridge. An adequate numbers of directional boards have been fixed at all the strategic points for the inconvenience of the motorist, so no question of any confusion arise in this regard.

@ Shiladitya Chatterjee...............in response to your facebook complaint vide memo no. F/B-360 dt.07.03.13. We like to inform you about your alleged complaint of traffic signal system near Jadavpur PS crossing. The concerned traffic guard sometimes operate signal manually mode due to heavy traffic in all side mainly peak hours, but when traffic signal is auto mode first we released the South bound traffic with right turn then North bound traffic after that west bound traffic then East & West both bound traffic at Jadavpur PS Crossing. If anything (such type) happening on duty Sergeant and men accordingly prosecute them by cited or in written both forms. All times one of the officers remain present over their for controlling the traffic system as well as prosecute the rule violator. 
When East to West & West to East signal is open then on duty Sergeant controls this cross over by placing both TP personnel on East & West side. TP on Eastern side stopped the West bound traffic and pulled over the East bound traffic, after getting instruction from on duty Sergeant opposite traffic personnel doing the same. As a result traffic from East & West bound moving very smoothly and try to clear quickly only for to avoid the chaotic traffic situation. Thanks & regards.

@ Pitam Das.................in reference to your facebook complaint vide memo no. F/B-447 dt-25.03.13. We like to inform you that in peak hours particularly in the morning time volume of north bound traffic of EM Bypass remain very high and this road of two lanes only. So the discharge time is higher. On the other hand P.A.S connector is (03) lane road and comparatively traffic is less. So, we have to give preference to the EM Bypass traffic, otherwise the tail sometimes reach up to Ajoy Nagar crossing which is more than one KM from the mention crossing. Whereas the tail of P.A.S connector never touches the Avisikata-2 signal which is only 230 mts from the mention crossing. The signal is completely depend  upon the volume of traffic. Thanks.

There is likely to be intense pressure of vehicles on Park Circus Connector and E M Bypass on 02.04.2013 from 4 PM to 8 PM, in connection with the inaugural ceremony of I P L 2013. Hence, vehicles not bound for Yuba Bharati Krirangan, are advised not to avail Park Circus Connector and E M Bypass. They are requested to avail A J C Bose Road / A P C Roy Road, Beliaghata Main Road / Manicktala Main Road, C I T Road and HUDCO crossing for north / east bound journey. Similarly, for city bound or Salt Lake bound journey from Kolkata Airport side please avail V I P Road, New Town, Salt Lake Sector V, Chingrighata, E M Bypass towards south.

Regards from Team KTP.

Our drives against chaotic/indisciplined plying of auto-rickshaws are on. While it is quite difficult to keep a round-the-clock tab on the several hundreds of auto routes in the city, we have sought to identify some of the more violation-prone stretches/routes and focus our concerted attention thereon. Hundreds of prosecutions are being launched on a daily basis by different traffic guards against illegal parking, playing of radio, signal violation, dangerous driving, RC/permit violation and so on. We are aware that such drives have to be continued with more intensity in the days to come so as to enforce better adherence to the rules of the road by autos and shall keep trying hard to achieve the same. It may take some time, but sustained efforts shall surely change things for the better. Here are some random captures of our special drives over the last week by teams of handpicked officers from KTP. 
Thanks and regards, Team KTP.

Plain-clothed traffic personnel from the special raid team of KTP posing as passengers caught red-handed as many as 74 taxi-drivers during the act of refusals over the last two days. Here are a few snapshots of the raids.  The drives have been continuing at least twice a week over the last six months at different refusal-prone stretches of the city and will continue in the days to come with greater intensity. Necessary legal actions ranging from prosecutions to temporary suspension of licenses have followed. As we have always maintained, the menace cannot be brought to an end overnight, but sustained efforts at enforcement shall surely improve things and we shall keep trying hard to bring about the same. Kindly post refusal-complaints on this page with details of taxi-number, date, time and place or call 1073/22143644. Thanks for your support. Regards from Team KTP.

The traffic Lok Adalat held last Sunday in the City Civil Court Complex has been a huge success with disposal of more than 95 thousand long-pending traffic violation cases in one go and resulting in a revenue generation of more than 47 lakh which will be deposited to Govt treasury by the court. The idea was to reduce the ever-increasing burden of pending cases on one hand, and providing people with a hassle-free single-window mechanism to settle their long-pending dues on account of traffic violations. A special team under the leadership of Shri Dipankar Sengupta, Assistant Commissioner, TP and Shri Manoj Kumar Das, OC Fatal Squad, Shri Tridip Datta, OC Traffic Computer Cell, Shri K K Bhattacharjee, OC MTV and Shri Amitava Guha, OC Raid toiled day and night over the last one month to make this possible. More such ventures will be organised shortly.
