The recently concluded Kolkata Book Fair was quite a challenge for us. Reduced carriageway space owing to the ongoing construction work of the Park Circus elevated corridor, the extended tenure of the fair, thousands of vehicles pouring in ceaselessly, unprecedented surge in footfall during the weekends, prophesies of traffic woes in sections of the media before the fair commenced......it was a daunting task ahead. We at KTP pulled out all the stops during the last fortnight to make the journey to/from the book fair as hassle-free as possible. We may have succeeded on certain fronts and may have failed on some ; but the effort was wholehearted and  sincerely directed at not letting down the city and the people we serve. Our gratitude to the unstinted cooperation we received from the visitors to the book fair , but for whose support we would have hardly been able to manage things to the best of our abilities. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@Prasenjit Mitra....... in reference to your complaint vide F/B No-26A dated 06.01.13, this to inform you that as per your complaint a report had been sought from the concerned TP Guard. As per the O/C of the concerned Guard,  that at the mentioned place there all corporation pipe line work is going on all along R.B. Ave, one of them is just is little west of Gariahat Crossing on R.B. Ave. Due to that pit of sewerage work the black top space is very narrow at the same point, if the Autos those who are availing R.V. Ave. from west/east take U turn from Garaihat Crossing then total traffic circulation of Gariahaat Crossing may be pandemonium. So in having no U turn on R.V. Ave. the TP Guards are allowing Autos to take U turn to avoid congestion of Traffic at Gariahat Crossing. Also for your information that from traffic point of view there is a Traffic signal board for not to take U turn from that point except Autos. Thanks.

@ Rahul Roy.........in reference to your facebook complaint vide F/B 1650 on 28.09.12 this is to report that the road condition on EM Bypass from VIP Bazar to Math Pukur has been improved after rainy seasons by KMDA. During rainy seasons there were lots of pits, potholes and bad drainage system. This reasons created obstruction to the movement of normal vehicular traffic. Now it has been improved.
       Besides, one complete time cycle of Parama Island is 150sec. according to the volume of the traffic divided in four parts:-
i) South to North =65 sec. ii)North to West=50sec. iii)West to North and South =25sec. and pedestrian  =10sec. and at this time cycle we got a good result in circulation of movement of vehicular traffic. Thanks & regards

On the basis of a complaint of Smt. Pritha Das Gupta, a reporter of Kolkata TV, a case has been registered  vide Lake PS Case No. 458 dated 24.12.12 U/S-307/ 354/ 506 IPC against an unknown Taxi driver of a Taxi bearing Registration No. WB19B 1304 for alleged misconduct, outrage of modesty and attempt to murder while she was traveling in the said taxi from Mullick Bazar to Mahanirban Road with further allegation of being dangerously driven out from the running vehicle by the said unknown taxi driver.
         The initial inputs related to address failed to fix up the actual owner of the referred taxi. This prompted the team of FSTP under the direct supervision of  Shri D K Adak, IPS,  Deputy Commissioner of Police, Traffic to explore further options. The team with the assistance of the officers of the Traffic Computer Cell and employing source network, zeroed in on the actual owner of the alleged vehicle. 
 	The investigation was monitored at every level on regular basis by DC Traffic and duly assisted by Inspector Manoj Kumar Das, OC FSTP.  Based on the inputs subsequent watch was maintained for hours together and the team succeeded in apprehending the taxi from Rubi Connector. This led to the arrest of the driver Ashok Singh of Chowbhaga Road, PS- Tiljala, Kolkata on 26.12.12.
On 28th December 2012 at 12.00 hrs Jumma prayer will be held at different part in the city.

@ Anil Gupta.......... in reference to your facebook complaint vide F/B No- 1517 dated 14.09.12 regarding traffic position/ situation, firstly highlight on some points:-
i) Lord Sinha Rd. is one way thoroughfare which reverses its direction at 1PM
ii)Parking is strictly restricted to one side of the road i.e. southern side.
iii)All schools situated on Lord Sinha Rd. are on the eastern side.
iv) School buses come to drop and pick up children at four times in a day and park for the time being on the eastern side i.e. the side which is no parking zone for the safety and security of the School children to avoid them from crossing the road.
    Western side being an KMC fee parking zone, space may not be available for buses are parked maximum time of 15 minutes for pick up and drop the school children, not affect the traffic for long time. Restriction is strictly maintain on Lord Sinha Road about parking except at the school time that only for safety and security of the children. However the KTP ensured that they will try for better traffic management before their level. Thanks & regards.

@ Aliq Rahaman ......... in reference to your facebook complaint(F/B 1344 dt. 31.08.12.) regarding parking at Port area as post report O/C of the Guard it is to be noted that the stretch of this road is not a notified 'No Parking Zone'.
        There is an entrance to Dock through Gate no -1, for heavy goods vehicles and such vehicles queue up during different times from gate no 1 to marine house on
the western flank in one single queue to get inside dock premises which is no way causes any obstruction to traffic. Any double line parking, if at all is immediately prosecuted by us from time to time.
       There are some units(Companies) Reserve Force of Kolkata Police at Paddapukur for which some Police vehicles including Police buses & vans are placed on the western flank of the road for dropping and pick up of force which does not hinder traffic . However constant vigil will be continue. Thanking for your observation

Snapshots of our sustained drives against taxi-refusal yesterday across the length and breadth of the city. Plain-clothed personnel of our special raid section, masquerading as passengers, could catch as many as 43 errant taxi-derivers redhanded. Needless to add, necessary punitive actions have followed. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@Sourav Saha ....... in reference your facebook complaint vide F/B 1408 dated 05.09.12 regarding blockage of roads infront of Julien Day School at Elgin Rd. during opening of gates at 11.15 hours, matter was enquired and the O/C of the concerned Guard visited the area and following points revels from the enquiry:-
i) The senior section of Julien Day School width of about 12ft. only.
ii) During the opening and closing of school, there is huge rush in connection with ingress and egress of school students. Although big vehicles like Bus can not pass through such a narrow road, small vehicles enter and stop infront of school premises for drop and pick up of students.
iii) In the said area there are several residence building also including Nursing Home which bring their vehicles also along the said stretch. 
iv) The western side of Umananda Rd. is Fee parking zone, approved by KMC. 
        Therefore all the above factors resulting traffic congestion during the school opening and closing time. However such practices never hamper the smooth circulation of Elgin Rd. The O/C also contacted with the Principal Mr. G. Gome and assure to deploy some TP personnel during this time to maintain the situation as better for smooth flow of traffic. Thanks & regards.

Pujas, in every sense of the term, are like annual exams for Kolkata Traffic Police. Oceans of people, private cars and public transport swarming the city round-the-clock from Panchami evening onwards till the stroke of Dashami dawn...a 16/ 18 hours a day schedule on the roads for five days and nights on the trot for every single member of the 4000-strong KTP family, with one single mission....to ensure a faster, safer and friendlier Puja for the citizens we serve.... to keep the city moving amidst all odds. Plans were drawn up meticulously well ahead of the Puja to meet this most daunting annual challenge. For the last five days/nights, we pulled out all the stops to deliver the goods when it mattered most. We tried our best; it is now for our esteemed members to judge whether we could live up to the expectations. Wishing all members Shuvo Bijaya from Team KTP. Thanks for the support. Warm regards....Supratim Sarkar, Joint CP ( Traffic)

essary papers relating to the vehicles except D/L only produced a money receipt of Howrah Motor Training School in support of applying for licence. And there (Girish Park) was Spl. raid going on against two wheeler.

All the circumstances, it appears that the prosecution is justified.

Besides our attempts to make auto-drivers adhere to the rules of the road through enforcement, educating them about traffic norms is an area KTP has been according priority since we believe that mere enforcement is not the solution. A  day-long workshop was organised on 23.9.12 at Calcutta Blind School for about 150 auto-drivers of Diamond Harbour Traffic Guard under the direct supervision of Shri Debabrata Das IPS, DC TP ( South), Shri Gautam Gupta, AC, TP and Shri Alok Sanyal, OC, Diamond Harbour Traffic Guard. The workshop focussed on behavioural skills and traffic norms and also comprised an eye check-up module. Filmstar Sohom, a Behala resident , graced the occasion as a special guest. Sharing a few pictures of the workshop. More such workshops, at least twice a month in different areas, will follow. Regards from Team KTP.

Plain-clothed KTP men from our special raid section caught 31 errant taxi-drivers during the act of refusal yesterday evening in and around Park Street-Camac Street crossing, Kalmandir, Minto Park, Hazra crossing, Malpara, Hiland Park, Ajaynagar crossing, Malapara, Girish Park, Peerless Hospital, Tollygunge Tram Depot, Golpark, Russel Street, Wellington Square, to name a few stretches. Necessary punitive actions ranging from fines to temporary suspension of license have followed. We shall keep trying our best to make the anti-Taxi-refusal drives more intensified in the days to come.

Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@Mahesh Kothari .... in reference your facebook complaint (F/B- 1410 dt.06.09.12), this is to inform you that the signal system at Girish Park is actually a systematically and technically operated signal. The cycle time of this signalling is as follows:- East to south + North at Girish Park crossing is 15second, in the evening 25 second +20 second. 
     Therefore, in 105 second cycle the vehicular traffic avails in the morning east to south - 55 second and in the evening - 60 second and for east to north + south - 15 second.

Sharing some photographs of the second session of the Facebook Friends' Forum held on Saturday last in the Briefing Room of Kolkata Police Headquarters. Great learning experience for us as the attendees exchanged their views on traffic management in the city in an interaction that went on for close to four hours instead of the originally planned two and a half hours ! We feel humbled by the active participation of the members who had spared time on a weekend to attend the session. All the suggestions/observations have been taken note of. We shall try to address/implement them to the best possible extent. Our grateful thanks to the attendees. There have been many whom we could not invite this time round due to space and time constraint.  Our apologies to them. We shall definitely seek their presence in the next session a couple of months later. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Inviting kind attention of the esteemed members.

We have been receiving a substantial complaints from members on a daily basis regarding taxi refusal and other issues. Many of these relate to areas beyond KTP jurisdiction. A large number of complaints pour in about incidents in Salt Lake Sector V, Lake-town, Baguiati, Airport Area. Kindly note that these areas fall within the purview of Bidhannagar City Police covering the following Police Stations: NSCBI Airport PS, Bidhannagar East, Lake Town, New Town, Baguihati Police Station, Bidhannagar South Police Station, Bidhannagar North Police Station, Airport Police Station, Electronics Complex Police Station.

For complaints in respect of these area, kindly contact Bidhannagar Commissionerate  at http://www.bidhannagarcitypolice.com/index.html.

As for complaints regarding incidents in Howrah and Barackpore areas, kindly contact http://howrahcitypolice.in/ & http://policewb.gov.in/wbp/bkp_commissionerate.php.

Thanks and regards, from Team KTP.

Plain-clothed KTP men from our special raid section caught 37 errant taxi-drivers during the act of refusal yesterday evening in and around Dalhousie,  Girish Park, Park Street, Behala Chowstha, Malapara, Rafi Ahmed Kidwai Road, Sarat Bose Road,  to name a few stretches. Necessary punitive actions ranging from fines to temporary suspension of license have followed. We shall keep trying our best to make the anti-refusal drives more intensified in the days to come.
  
Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@ Amritendu Sen Gupta……Your post on 2nd September 2012, read…” Sharing an experiences.Today I was getting my car fixed at EM.BYPASS bidhanshiudhan X ng at around 11.30am.There were 2 sergeants who were checking vehicles along with a home guard and a so called civilian.At around 11.45am they stopped a couple as the pillion rider was not wearing helmet.The sergeant politely informed them about the importance of helmet. I saw that the While they were speaking the home guard and so called civil dressed police started to check the papers of the 2 wheeler I approached and asked who he was & why he is doing the job of police when a sergeant is present.I was stunned to hear that the so called civil dressed police was a normal civilian.I immidietly protested to the concerned sergeant and demanded to know how he is allowing a local boy to check 2 wheeler documents? Upon hearing this the hooligan who was doing police duty abused me verbally and with his fingers pointed at me started abusing in front of the sergeant.The picture attached is of the hooligan police.SO ARE YOU SO CRUNCH IN MANPOWER THAT NOW A DAYS LOCAL HOOLIGANS ARE DOING POLICE DUTY?Along with him was a home guard who said his name was Tubai Karmakar and his TP NO-30336.This person was also shouting along with the hooligan. Couldn't get the name of the sergeant How ever The police bike number was-WB-01-X-2232.Date2/09/12.time 11.45am.My question is how can a person who is nowhere attached with the police stop vehicle and check papers that too in front of a sergeant?requesting strict action at the earliest. Regards”

This is to bring your kind notice that we had initiated a thorough enquiry based on your complaint and found that the name of person in green T-shirt is Bidyut Parika who is a home-guard attached to Kolkata police and was performing duty in plain- cloth and person performing duty in uniform was ASI Ashok Kumar Palai of Maniktala PS, who was deployed from Maniktala PS regarding raid against unruly drivers. KTP apart, the local police stations also hold vehicle-checking exercises regularly and at times in civil dress too for infusing a surprise element. There might have been some communication-gap which had led you into believing that civilians were being entrusted police jobs. That was not the fact. They were KP personnel, let alone being hooligans. Having said that, the misbehaviour of those on duty that you have alleged about is unacceptable. The concerned DCP has been requested to enquire into the misbehaviour aspect and take needful action.Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

The Kolkata Traffic Police Facebook page membership reaches 20,000 !  It is heartening to note that when the year began, the membership figures hovered just around 5000-odd, but over the last six months, the figures have gone up at a progressively ascending rate and before we knew it, the 'likes' shot up to 13000 by mid-july and as we approach mid-September the KTP Facebook page boasts of the support of no less than 20 K and more importantly, has evolved into an effective enforcement tool for us ! While on one hand, it is a matter of satisfaction for the KTP family that more and more citizens of this beloved city of ours are reposing their faith on us, whereas on the other, the ever-growing membership makes us more aware of the expectations of the people we serve and the responsibility that comes with it. Since the inception of this page, we have always maintained that we are open to all kinds of views/suggestions/criticism/observations and that is exactly what the page is meant for.......making a sincere effort towards better traffic management through meaningful interaction with the citizens. Managing the city traffic day in and day out, we are sure our members will kindly appreciate, is quite a challenging, if not thankless, job. We have been trying hard to address the major areas of concern for the citizens by a careful analysis of the posts ; at times we succeed, and on many occasions we fail, but kindly trust us, we never cease trying to make a difference, however small that may be. Encouraging words strengthen our resolve to be persistent with our efforts, criticism makes us more aware of our shortcomings ; we at KTP try to take both in our stride and seek to improve therefrom. This page derives its source of sustenance, more than anything else, from the active participation of its members and we take this opportunity to offer our grateful thanks to each and every member. Heartiest regards...... Supratim Sarkar, Joint CP Traffic

Some members have of late observed that this page is turning into a redressal forum for taxi-refusals only and the other issues are ignored or not accorded due attention to. Kindly allow us to submit our views. The number of complaints about a particular issue on this page, as we perceive them, are broadly indicative of the gravity of the same and the extent to which it affects the citizenry who are members of our FB family. Going by that yardstick,if we go by a rough percentage measure, about 65 % of the posts per month relate to taxi-refusal, 15% about chaotic auto-driving, 5% about pollution-related issues like smoke-emission and honking, 5% about traffic rule violations by police, 5% relate to illegal parking and signal-pulse issues and the remaining 5% about area-specific miscellaneous matters. These, we reiterate, are rough percentages which have not shown any significant variation over the last few months. The responses to the taxi-refusa
l complaints, as a result, will naturally outnumber responses on other issues. Having said that, let us humbly submit that if you notice carefully, other areas of concern too are responded to with due priority but those posts probably get overshadowed by the sheer numerical prowess of our taxi-refusal responses. We have never claimed to have addressed all issues to the satisfaction of citizens, but just for the sake of record, taxi-refusal is not the sole issue this page seeks to address. We may upload a good number of photos/statistics of the anti-honking/anti-pollution prosecutions done daily and the raids against illegal parking at violation-prone spots as also the action-taken reports in respect of violations by police personnel, but that just might seem an exercise in self-patting. One may argue that the same logic should apply for taxi-refusal raids and why snapshots of our anti-refusal drives are uploaded regularly. Our humble response is that as per available statistics of the posts on this page and a careful analysis of the same, taxi-refusal is a problem that affects the netizenry of this page most and it is our duty to assure them that their complaints are duly acted upon by sharing regularly the highlights of our actions. We have been trying to address the taxi-refusal posts sincerely, but not at the expense of other posts. It is difficult to deliver instant justice to all posts since necessary enquiries and legal processes have to be adhered to and that consumes time. We are sorry and apologize for the delayed response in some cases, but the delay is not due to lack of attention/priority to a particular issue. 
Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

This is regarding the proposed second session of the Facebook Friends' Forum to be held at Lalbazar, Kolkata Police Headquarters on 22.9.12. at 4 pm. We are humbled by the response to our post about the same; more than 100 members have so far volunteered to attend the session and as we had mentioned in our earlier post, given the time and space constraint, we shall be inviting 75 members for the session, according preference to those who had not attended the first session in June last. The raids against taxi-refusal by our plain-clothed teams continue. Sharing herewith a few captures of the raid. Over the last couple of days, our teams focussed on Gilander House, Canning street-Brabourne Road crossing, Dalhousie area in general, Camac Street-Shakespeare Sarani crossing, Girish Park, Hazra crossing, Minto Park, College Street, to name a few stretches, resulting in 53 prosecutions against errant taxi-drives who were caught off-guard. Punitive actions ranging from prosecutions to temporary cancellation of licenses have followed.  As we have always maintained, curbing the menace of taxi-refusal completely may be a far cry, but sustained enforcement will surely make a difference in the long run. We are aware that complaints are still pouring in substantial numbers and we shall keep trying persistently to make a difference. Kindly post taxi-refusal complaints on this page or telephonically on 1073.

Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

The traffic Lok Adalat held last saturday in the City Civil Court Complex has been a huge success with disposal of more than 67 thousand long-pending traffic violation cases in one go and resulting in a revenue generation of more than 32 lakh which will be deposited to Govt treasury by the court. The idea was to reduce the ever-increasing burden of pending cases on one hand, and providing people with a hassle-free single-window mechanism to settle their long-pending dues on account of traffic violations. A special team under the leadership of Shri Dipankar Sengupta, Assistant Commissioner, TP and Shri Manoj Kumar Das, OC Fatal Squad, Shri Tridip Datta, OC Traffic Computer Cell, Shri K K Bhattacharjee, OC MTV toiled day and night over the last one month to make this possible. More such ventures will be organised shortly. 

Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

The photograph posted herewith is of Shri Maniklal Murmu, Constable no 14635 of Ultadanga Traffic Guard, who has made KTP proud ! At around 15 35 hours today, at the crossing of Bagmari Road and CIT Road, while an elderly lady was walking along the footpath of CIT Road from North to South, two miscreants on a motorcycle, moving in the same direction, attempted to snatch the gold-chain of the lady. The lady was caught unawares, almost fell down and the chain broke into pieces. Shri Maniklal Murmu, performing beat duty at the crossing, ran towards the motorcycle which was trying to speed away, caught hold of the pillion-rider,pushed him and managed to get the driver off balance as the motorcycle fell by the wayside. Local public rushed in , helped apprehend the two miscreants who were handed over soon after to Maniktala Police Station wherein a specific criminal case has been registered under appropriate sections of law. The motorcycle has been seized. Shri Murmu sustained minor injuries in the process. He has been suitably rewarded immediately thereafter by the Commissioner of Police. We are proud of Shri Murmu. May there be more like him ! Regards from Team KTP.

Inviting kind attention of the esteemed members. We had organized a ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' on 16.6.12 afternoon at the Kolkata Police Headquarters wherein 41 members had volunteered to spare their valuable time and had attended the session. The idea was to have a face-to-face interaction of willing members with the senior officers of Kolkata Traffic Police wherein a free exchange of views/sug
gestions/complaints/criticism could pave the way for better traffic management in the city. The response, to say the least, was overwhelming ; the session, originally slated to last for two hours, stretched to four hours and we at KTP benefitted to a great extent by the suggestions/observations of the participants. We propose to organize the second session of the ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' on 22nd September, Saturday at 4 PM at the Kolkata Police Headquarters. Members willing to participate may please inform us in response to this post or may send a mail to the following mail-addresses as early as possible. octcc@kolkatatrafficpolice.gov.in nilesh1304@gmail.com
sudipto.pri@gmail.com

Formal mails inviting willing members will be sent from this end in a few days' time. We would love to invite as many willing members as possible, but since the time the participants would be sparing on a weekend is precious and we would ideally like to limit the duration of the session to a maximum of two and a half hours, we are constrained to restrict the number of participants to 75. If the number of willing members exceeds that, we would have to restrict ourselves to the first 75 confirmations that we receive and accord more priority to those who have not had the opportunity to attend the first session. Let us humbly submit that the members whom we will be unable to accommodate this time round will most definitely be invited to the next session in November. This is a forum which sustains itself on the ever-growing support of the members and we hope that the whole-hearted participation of members will make the upcoming session of the ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' a huge success and strengthen our resolve to make the city traffic ''faster,safer and friendlier''. For any further queries, members may get in touch with Sgt Nilesh Choudhury 9830244145 or Sgt Sudipto Mukherjee 9836863377. Awaiting your positive response. Thanks and regards.

Supratim Sarkar, Joint CP ( Traffic )

@Das Debtirtha.... in reference your facebook complaint Vide F/B No 1052 dt. 02.08.12and TPR 4608/3 dt. 07.08.12 this is to inform you that the rule 269 of WBMV Rule,1989 display of photograph together with the name and the license number of the person engaged in driving a motor cab-“Every motor cab within the regions of Culcutta and Howrah and if so directed by the Regional Transport Authority for any other region, also within such other region, shall carry a copy of the photograph, together with the name and the address and the license number of the person engaged in driving it. Such photograph, name and license number shall be so placed as to be clearly visible to the hirer when inside the motor cab.”  This is pertinent to be mentioned here that the rule stated hereinabove, shall be applicable to the auto-rickshaw also since having contract carriage permit in terms of rule 120(4)(i) of west Bengal Motor Vehicles Rules’1989.

@Arudra Gupta……… in reference your facebook complaint vide F/B 898 dt. 19.07.12 regarding signaling in front of JADAVPUR P.S. you observed that the red signal is on and there is a timer, even when the countdown in timer ‘zero’ the red light is still on. It may be happened as because the crossing is very busy in peak hours and then signal mode was changed to manual mode, but some technical reasons the countdown timer still going on’ it can only happen in red signal but never observed in green signal. Control device agency has informed for necessary rectification. Thanking you.

@Jinee Surana.... in reference your face book complaint vide F/B No 1037 dt.01.08.12 regarding  traffic Signal of M.G. Rd. and Stand Rd. crossing, this is to inform you that the signal is not out of order. In the morning upto around 10.00hrs and also in the holidays the signal is operating in auto mode. Afterthat due to heavy Traffic and also the frequent tram services on M.G. Rd. and also under the flyover on the crossing when the trams cars change direction, the other vehicles can’t cross the xing on auto signal mode. So for the benefit  of traffic, changed the signal mode from auto to blinker and traffic Police give the hand signal for the vehicles.

This is a forum which sustains itself on the ever-growing support of the members and we hope that the whole-hearted participation of members will make the upcoming session of the ''Facebook Friends' Forum'' a huge success and strengthen our resolve to make the city traffic ''faster,safer and friendlier''. For any further queries, members may get in touch with Sgt Nilesh Choudhury 9830244145 or Sgt Sudipto Mukherjee 9836863377. Awaiting your positive response. Thanks and regards.

Supratim Sarkar, Joint CP ( Traffic )

It is a bit disturbing to observe that a few members, just a handful, have of late been using slang/abusive language in their comments in response to our posts. We are of course at liberty to delete the comment or block the concerned person and shall definitely resort to the same if things reach such a pass ; but that is a last recourse and we do not wish to forego the support/suggestion/criticism of any of our 18, 650 members. Just a humble request to those who have been posting unmentionables in a public interaction domain : please let this page retain its sanctity in terms of the language used. Do feel free to criticize/ suggest/ observe / complain whatever and whenever you feel like and that is exactly what this page is meant for....a forum for meaningful interaction with citizens to find out ways and means for better traffic management, but please do desist from using filthy slangs. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

@ Subhajoy Roy…. your FB complaint on 25.07.2012 read……” Last night i faced two refusals, one from a taxi driver and another from a policeman in traffic control room. i was returning home after work with my colleagues and we were looking for taxis around 9pm.
several taxis refused to go and we didn't object to that. i asked one taxi (WB04B 1064) in front of E-mall (Central Avenue--Madan Street crossing) and it agreed to go. my colleagues were supposed to go to Garia and i had said that. the moment i called my colleagues, who were standing some distance away, to come, the driver asked how many of us were there. i said four and he instantly demanded Rs 400. this irritated me and i became determined that i won't give that amount.
i asked one colleague to get inside the taxi. as he opened the door, the driver sped up and tried to flee. i opened the front left door and jumped into the taxi while it was moving. the driver didn't stop.
the driver took the first left turn from Madan Street and took the taxi inside Chandni Chowk. this time i was afraid as i was alone inside the cab. my colleagues were running after the cab.
while i was inside, the driver repeated, "jeta bollam shunecho. 400 taka lagbe. etai raat e jawar niyom."
by now i had called up the traffic control room and started narrating the incident. the driver seemed a bit afraid when i called police and stopped the car.
TCR was co-operative the first time. the policeman on phone asked me the location of the taxi and wanted the vehicle's number. he told me not to leave the car and promised to send an officer to the spot.
i had to get down to note the vehicle's number, since the number written inside was smudged. as expected, the driver fled with the car as soon as i got down. but i managed to give the number. the call got disconnected.
by now, my colleagues, who were running after the taxi had arrived. we again went back in front of E-mall. one of my colleague, Monalisa Chaudhuri, called TCR to lodge a complaint. but she was told that TCR cannot take such a complaint. she was directed to call 1073.
we left the matter and started looking for a new cab. soon we found one. inside the new cab, we sat silently for about three minutes. then i again called TCR, to ask why they wouldn't take the complaint.
as i said, "dada amader ekta taxi refusal hoyeche", the policeman on phone said, "apni ke." when i said i am a commuter, he shouted, "dada bolchen kake. apni apnar dada-tada hoy na."
his behaviour made me angry and i shouted back. i asked him what is wrong if i call a policeman "dada". i also asked him why he wouldn't take the complaint.
according to my phone call records, this call was made at 9.20pm. the clock in my mobile phone is about 8 minutes fast.
the argument grew and i told him that i will write a detailed account on facebook saying that TCR refused to take comlplaint. he mellowed down immediately. he started saying, "dada ami complaint nebo na bolini, ami apnake ar ekta number e ph korte bolechi."
i cut the phone on his face.
my question is can't a commuter call a policeman/woman dada? and can't police take a complaint and do the needful on their own than directing the victim to another number.
and is there a rule that TCR cannot take taxi refusal complaint that this policeman told me?”. This is to inform you that Debendra Barik the offending driver has been brought to book followed by prosecution and temporary cancellation of license. As for the response of TCR, concerned officer has been briefed adequately by senior officers.

A little bit of innovation always helps as far as traffic management at critical crossings goes. Bhawanipore Traffic Guard under the leadership of Shri Biplab Singha, OC, Bhawanipore Traffic Guard, has of late introduced ''Mirror vision system'' at the crossing of Belvedre Road and Hastings Park Road whereby north-bound vehicles travelling along Hastings Park Road now can clearly view the Belevedre Road traffic in the vicinity of the crossing. Suggestions from esteemed members about practically implementable traffic engineering are most welcome. Here are a few photographs of the new installation. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

We are in receipt of many posts/complaints of late regarding traffic snarls during peak office hours along the stretch from Chingrighata to Parama Island and further west to Park Circus 7-point as also on EM Bypass from Ruby to Parama and further north. We are aware of the same . Kindly allow us to submit the reasons thereof. Commuters along that route must surely be aware that the work of the elevated corridor along the Park Circus connector is on in full swing and the road space has got reduced by more than half while the traffic volume is on the rise day-by-day. Add to that the blockades on the southern flank of New Park Street near 4 no bridge for the emergency work of essential underground utility services, further reducing the available road space. The Kohinoor Market crossing and the Gobinda Khatik crossing are the two major bottlenecks. A huge pier of the elevated corridor is coming up at the former while the pedestrian crossovers at the latter are taking more time than usual due to the limited space. Since a bulk of vehicles proceeding eastward from 7 point to Parama usually move southward along Topsia Road (South) from Kohinoor Market crossing, the right turn has to be allowed frequently and while it is done, the East-bound traffic gets tailed up on one hand due to absence of another lane-space and the West-bound traffic from Parama too gets halted. Further, the north-bound traffic from Ruby to Parama along EM Bypass also has bof late been suffering due to the poor condition of the rain-hit service roads which most vehicles are not inclined to take. Synchronizing the east and west-bound traffic by way of according proportionate preference to both depending on the real-time traffic volume is what we are trying to do to the best possible extent. Additional manpower has been deployed, but we are sure that you would appreciate that the road space vis-a-vis the volume of traffic cannot be effectively redressed by mere augmentation of traffic personnel. These are not excuses, we are trying our best within the given constraints; but the ground realities are such that this traffic congestion is something we possibly have to bear with for some more time. We expect things to improve for the better within a fortnight's time.We are pursuing hard with the different agencies to complete as much of the ongoing work as early as possible and the agencies too are working overtime. Kindly bear with us. Apologies to the commuters for the inconvenience. Thanks and regards, Team KTP

The Taratala- Thakurpukur stretch, we could gather from feedback/complaints, happens to be one of the more violation-prone stretches ( close to 3000 autos ply along this stretch) as far as indisciplined auto-driving is concerned. Apart from the common allegations regarding indisciplined/dangerous driving, indiscriminate parking, carrying excess passengers etc, one of the most recurring complaints along this stretch is about route-truncation with autos refusing to go the entire distance and resorting to short-distance break-journeys. The Diamond Harbour Road Traffic Guard, over the last month, under the leadership of Shri Alok Sanyal, OC , Diamond harbour Traffic Guard,has launched hundreds of prosecutions against autos and a sizeable quantity among them being against route-truncation ( u/s 66/192 MV Act ). The local traffic guard is trying hard to improve the sense of road-discipline among the auto-drivers. Flexes / hoardings have been put up in strategic places displaying the phone-numbers of the local traffic guard where citizens may call and lodge telephonic complaints about auto-refusals, route truncation etc. A good number of prosecutions have been launched so far on the basis of telephonic complaints. Humbly requesting the commuters along this route to note down the number of the offending auto and post it on this page or call the local guard office at 2479-8210 / 24883872 to help us take lawful action. Posting herewith a few snapshots of a special drive by DH Traffic Guard over the last couple of days. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Alongside sustained efforts towards enforcing better road-discipline by auto-drivers through regular raids and prosecutions, we have felt the need for educating auto-drivers about driving norms and rules of the road by way of organising sensitisatio- workshops. One such day-long workshop was organised at Jagadbandhu Institution on 18.8.12 by South East Traffic Guard for about 100 auto-drivers of Gariahat-Golpark area with thrust on driving norms, relevant provisions of traffic laws, behavioural patterns/ soft skills etc. The response was quite encouraging. More such workshops, at least two per month, will be organised as we are of the belief that mere enforcement alone may not yield the desired results unless it is coupled with meaningful education. Here are a few photographs of the workshop. Thanks and regards...Supratim Sarkar, Joint CP Traffic.

Our drives against chaotic/indisciplined plying of auto-rickshaws are on. While it is quite difficult to keep a round-the-clock tab on the several hundreds of auto routes in the city, we have sought to identify some of the more violation-prone stretches/routes and focus our concerted attention thereon. Hundreds of prosecutions are being launched on a daily basis by different traffic guards against illegal parking, playing of radio, signal violation, dangerous driving, RC/permit violation and so on. We are aware that such drives have to be continued with more intensity in the days to come so as to enforce better adherence to the rules of the road by autos and shall keep trying hard to achieve the same. It may take some time, but sustained efforts shall surely change things for the better. Here are some random captures of a special drive against errant autos by East Traffic Guard under the leadership of Shri Naushad Ali, OC, East Traffic Guard.

We had received quite a few complaints in the recent past, through this page and otherwise as well, regarding poor traffic management in and around Laxmipat Singhania School near Judges Court Road and Alipore Road crossing particularly during the morning hours when the school opens. Many had expressed concern about the safety of the school-children, attributing the same to chaotic and haphazard movement of cars carrying the students. Managing traffic during the opening and closing hours of most of the major schools in the city  is indeed a daunting task, given the unusually huge vehicular/pedestrian traffic volume within a very short time-span of 15/20 minutes, locational variables ( while some are bang on the road, some are housed in narrow lanes and some in the vicinity of extermely busy crossings), inadequate parking space, absence of specific entry and exit roads, big schoolbuses fighting for space with two-wheelers, four-wheelers and even taxis/autos etc. Having said that, we have been trying to bring out improvement, however little  that may be, in managing school-hour traffic by way of extra deployment from within our limited resources and working out innovative circulation flow to the extent possible. OC South-West Traffic Guard, for example, has been able to bring about some discipline in the vicinity of Laxmipat Singhania School during the opening hours through persistent efforts. Many of the parents have written to us complimenting the efforts. The school management too has appreciated the move. Here is a copy a letter from the Principal of the school acknowledging the endeavour. We request the members to kindly come up with practically implementable suggestions with regard to better traffic management during the opening/closing hours of schools.While nothing much can immediately be done about the vehicular/pedestrian traffic volume and the number of students, suggestions pertaining to safety of school/home-bound children will be most welcome. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

The Traffic Control Room (TCR) is an extremely important component of Kolkata Traffic Police wherefrom the traffic situation in the city is monitored round-the-clock by a hand-picked team of officers and men and where we receive thousands of telephone calls from citizens throughout the day and night seeking traffic updates, complaining about taxi-refusals and a host of other traffic-related issues. The call-takers at the TCR are being repeatedly briefed from time to time to respond to all calls timely and be extremely patient and polite while responding to the callers. Though we do not usually receive too many complaints about unwarranted behaviour by the TCR staff, we still thought that imparting some specialised training about soft-skills and telephone-etiquette might be of great help to them in serving the citizens in a more efficient and friendly manner. A four-day capsule course on “ Soft skills and telephone etiquette'' is currently under way at TCR and is being conducted by Sangshaptak Management Services, a professional consultant firm . Here are a couple of captures of the workshop in session. We are hopeful that this will help in further honing the behavioural and conversational skills of the personnel manning the TCR where the phone never stops ringing ! Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Curbing the indisciplined and chaotic driving by a substantial section of the 20,000 plus auto-drivers in the city is quite a challenging task for KTP. We have, however, been sincerely trying to improve things by focussing on certain violation-prone stretches systematically . The Gariahat-Golpark sector is one such stretch wherefrom a large number of complaints regularly pour in. Apart from other violations, most of these refer to the tendency of autos making abrupt u-turns near Gariahat crossing from cut-outs wherefrom such roundabouts are prohibited. Sustained vigil and repeated prosecutions have curbed the menace of late to a reasonable extent. We don't claim to have ensured a violation-free sector ; habits die hard and some drivers still continue to take a chance to hoodwink us in the lean traffic hours, but by and large, a greater degree of road discipline has been enforced through a large number of prosecutions launched recently by South-East Traffic Guard in and around Gariahat crossing against signal violation, dangerous driving , stop-line violation, centre-line violation, indiscriminate parking,permit violation etc. Intensive enforcement apart, we are also planning to hold area-wise workshops for auto-drivers soon with a view to sensitize them about driving norms and adherence to traffic norms. Efforts may not yield dramatic results overnight, but we shall keep trying whole-heartedly. Here are a few snapshots of law catching up with errant auto-driving. Thanks for the support. Regards from Team KTP .

Due to the disruption in train services due to the power grid collapse, the volume of pedestrian traffic, who would have otherwise availed trains, has increased manifold in the city streets seeking alternative home-bound transport. A large number of light signals also have stopped working. We are trying our best to manage traffic manually therein. All this have resulted in heavy traffic in sealdah sector, gariahat-garia south-bound sector and diamondharbour road. Within these unforeseen constraints, we are trying hard to manage the peak-hour traffic to the best possible extent. Kindly bear with us . 
Regards from Team KTP.

The traffic lokadalat held last saturday in the Alipore Court Complex has been an unprecedented success with disposal of more than 1 lakh 33 thousand long- pending traffic violation cases in one go and resulting in a revenue generation of more than 50 lakh which will be deposited to Govt treasury by the court. This is definitely one of the largest-ever disposal figures in a single day by a single court anywhere in the country and most certainly the largest-ever traffic case disposal in the state in a day. The idea was to reduce the ever-increasing burden of pending cases on one hand, and providing people with a hassle-free single-window mechanism to settle their long-pending dues on account of traffic violations. A special team under the leadership of Shri Dipankar Sengupta, Assistant Commissioner, TP and Shri Manoj Kumar Das, OC Fatal Squad, Shri Tridib Datta, OC Traffic Computer Cell, Shri Amitava Guha, OC Raid  toiled day and night over the last one month to make this possible. More such ventures will be organised shortly. 
Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Our relentless drives against taxi-refusal continue. Many of the members, while appreciating our efforts to curb the menace, have expressed concern as to whether such raids/ drives will turn into just once-in-a-while affairs. We assure the members most emphatically that such drives shall continue regularly and with even greater intensity. Posted hereinabove are few snapshots of some offending taxi-drivers who had probably started believing that they were above law and could get away with their whims. Our plain-clothed teams masquerading as passengers yesterday evening/night took them by surprise and needless to add, altogether 35 of them were strictly dealt with (Prosecutions/ Licence-suspension).  Let us also humbly state that we keep posting these snaps not to beat our own trumpet; the only purpose is to keep assuring the citizens that KTP is trying with all its might to curb the menace. Let us reiterate that these drives are held at least once a week and shall continue in right earnest without any let-up. Kindly keep posting taxi-refusal complaints. Trust us, all complaints are acted upon to the best extent possible. 
Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Many of the members have of late been wondering aloud as to whether KTP has plans to launch drives against errant autos on similar lines of our taxi-refusal raids and have suggested that we should focus serious attention on autos too. This is to humbly inform members that regular prosecutions are launched against auto-rickshaws too for dangerous driving, refusals, route-truncation, carrying excess passengers, misbehaviour etc. That a lot more needs to be done in a sustained manner is borne out by the complaints we receive regularly on this page. An analysis of the posts on this page as also the complaints we receive through other sources revealed that the stretch from Taratala to Thakurpukur is one of the most troublesome ones in respect of indisciplined/erratic/whimsical auto-driving. Special attention has been accorded to this stretch in  a focussed manner over the last fortnight on a daily basis by Diamond Harbour Traffic Guard and Thakurpukur Traffic Guard. One of the members had actually taken the pains of noting down the number of a few autos which are in the habit of regularly indulging in route-truncation and posted on this page. This is to inform the esteemed members that over the last few days, as many as 17 autos in the concerned stretch have been prosecuted under 66 (1)/ 192 MV Act ( driving without permit or in contravention with the permit conditions ) which entails a fine of Rs 3000/- . A slip mentioning the phone number of DH Road Traffic Guard has been circulated locally in large numbers so that passengers can complain about auto-refusals and other allied violations. Flexes  have also been put up  at Behala Chowrasta, Behala Tram Depot and Ajanta cinema mentioning similar details. The feedback and support from the local citizenry has been very encouraging . The drives will continue. We shall gradually focus in a concerted fashion on other areas of the city too to bring about disciplined auto-driving to the best extent possible. We are aware that it would take   intense efforts over a substantial period of time to bring about large-scale improvement. Kindly keep posting about auto-related issues. We shall try our best to improve things. Thanks and regards from Team KTP.

Here are some random captures of a few taxi-drivers who were caught redhanded in the act of refusal yesterday during a special day-long drive by our handpicked plain-clothed teams. The teams  fanned out across the city with focus on Tollygunge Metro and Tollygunge Tram Depot, Park Street-Camac Street, Lindsay Street, South City, Mani Square, Coal India( Dalhousie), Ruby crossing, RN Tagore Hospital, Sealdah station complex.....just to mention a few. A total of 32 drivers were booked with punitive actions ranging from prosecutions/ licence-suspension. Such drives are being held for the last few months, at least once a week, resulting in all-time high prosecution figures against taxi-refusal. The magnitude of the problem, we are aware, cannot be drastically lessened overnight unless we continue to sustain our vigil with the same intensity.  Amidst the day-to-day unenviable challenge of traffic management in an ever-growing metropolis (in terms of population and vehicles alike), combating taxi-refusal is something we shall continue to accord due priority to. Thanks for the support and encouragement.Wishing all a safe and happy weekend. Warm regards. 
Supratim Sarkar Joint CP ( Traffic )

Here goes yet another example of law catching up with the offender in reasonably quick time. The Telegraph this morning has carried another first-hand account of yet another disturbing incident of taxi-refusal and subsequent misbehaviour . This matter was reported at 9 30 pm on saturday to traffic control room telephonically on 1073 soon after the incident and our special raid section under the leadership of Inspector Monoj Kumar Das sprang into action immediately. Tracking him down turned out to be a little more difficult than we had thought as he played elusive for more than 72 hours till KTP could finally lay his hands on him this afternoon. Md Irfan, the offending driver, was arrested about an hour back from Topsia area and his licence has been suspended for six months. Many of our esteemed members, while reacting to our earlier post a few days back regarding a similar arrest, had opined that mere suspension of licence is not a strong enough deterrent. We humbly submit that within the existing legal provisions,  this is the most stringent punitive action KTP can initiate. This apart, some had felt in the same vein that KTP reacts more promptly only on incidents  highlighted by the media. Let us humbly state that we accord same priority to all taxi-refusal complaints, notwithstanding whether they are received through facebook, 1073 or the media. Since the beginning of this year, licences of hundreds of errant drivers have been suspended and prosecutions have been launched in thousands, more than treble the comparative figures last year during the same period. We, however, are aware that there's still a long way to go towards our aim of minimising the problem to the best extent possible. Please keep posting complaints of taxi-refusal on this page or kindly ring 1073 mentioning the date, time and taxi number. We shall keep trying our best.          
Warm regards....Supratim Sarkar , Joint CP Traffic

Here is the photograph of Md Shamim, an errant taxi-driver whom the law has caught up with. Many of you have must have gone through the first-hand account in today's The Telegraph about the torment that two ladies had to undergo recently on account of refusal and subsequent misbehaviour by a taxi driver (WB-04D-8722). Many of the members have rightly voiced their concern and anguish over the incident and urged us to take proper punitive action against the offender. We are happy to inform that the special raid team of KTP has been on the job from  early this morning and has been able to nab the offending driver( Md. Shamim) from Kashipore area a little while ago. The driver has been prosecuted as per relevant provisions of law and his license has been suspended for a period of six months. While it is quite a daunting task to keep a tab on the behavioural patterns of more than 30,000 taxi-drivers round-the-clock day in and day out across the length and breadth of the city, the drives against taxi-refusal at particularly vulnerable points are on and will continue in right earnest. KTP is trying its level-best to curb the menace. Kindly post on this page (along with date, time and taxi number ) whenever you are refused by a taxi or ring 1073 (toll-free number of traffic control room ) so as to help us initiate action. Warm regards.

Supratim Sarkar 

Joint CP (Traffic)

An exemplary piece of humane act that has done Kolkata Traffic Police proud! Sergeant Samrat  Dhali of Vidyasagar Setu Traffic Guard,while performing duty on Vidyasagar Setu on 23.6.12, had spotted an elderly gentleman in almost a state of unconsciousness in one of the window seats in a private bus of Alambazar-Duttafulia route while it was stuck in a signal. He sensed that something could be wrong with the gentleman , promptly boarded the bus and could gather that the person was in serious respiratory distress and his body had got stiffened. He thereafter arranged to carry the indisposed gentleman down from the bus, got hold of a taxi standing nearby, placed him therein and escorted the taxi to Central Medical Research Institute in Ekbalpore all by himself. On reaching the hospital, Sgt  Dhali prevailed on the medical staff to arrange for his immediate admission to ICCU. The attending doctors opined that the ailing person had suffered a cardiac attack and a little more delay in treatment could have proved fatal. While the preliminary treatment was on, Sgt Dhali could gather from the call-list of his cellphone that the gentleman , a resident of Salt Lake, works as an accounts executive in a Howrah branch of Union Bank and informed his colleagues, wife and daughter about the incident. His near and dear ones arrived soon after. The gentleman , we are relieved to learn , is on his way to recovery. The photograph posted herewith shows Sgt Dhali being felicitated by senior officers of Kolkata Traffic Police for his rare act of humanism which has done the entire force proud. He is being recommended for Commissioner of Police's 'Silver Disc' , an award most prestigious in Kolkata Police. May there be many more like you , Samrat!

From left to right: Shri Subir Kumar Ghosh, OC , Vidyasagar Setu , Traffic Guard, Shri Dilip Adak,DC(Traffic), Shri Supratim Sarkar ,Joint CP (Traffic), Shri Samrat Dhali , Sri Soumen Mitra , Addl CP(II).

One of the suggestions in the recently held “Facebook Friends’ Forum” was to appraise the members about the restrictive regulations in respect of different categories of goods vehicles plying in the city.  Here goes a brief overview of the same for kind perusal and information of the members. 

RESTRICTIONS FOR GOODS VEHICLES

• 24 HOURS LORRY CORRIDOR.

 1. BT Road, Cossipore Road (in between Galif Street & Khagen Chatterjee Road)- Khagen Chatterjee Road- Galif Street-  Canal East- Canal West are used  as lorry corridor  in North Kolkata. 
 2. V Setu, St. Georges Gate Road ( in between Hastings crossing and Clyde Row), Clyde Row, Napier Road, GR Road , CGR Road ( except portion between Hastings Crossing and Satya Doctor Road), Taratala Road, Hide Road are used as Lorry corridor to facilitate movement of Port related vehicles.

• 1200 HRS -1600 HRS LORRY CORRIDOR 
New Alipore Station Road, New Alipore Petrol Pump, Sahapore Road, DH Road, Taratola Road,  TC Road,  DPS Road, PA Shah Road, PA Shah Connector, EM By Pass ( between PA Shah Connector & Dhalai Bridge)- further South. 

• RESTRICTION OF POL TANKERS/LORRIES CARRYING LPG CYLINDERS/LPG BULLET TANKERS.  ( On All Week Days)
1. POL Tankers- restricted in between 09.00 hrs and 11.00 hrs. 
2.  Lorries carrying LPG Cylinders- restricted in between 09.00 hrs and 12.00 hrs. &   16.00 hrs. and 19.00 hrs.
3. LPG Bullet Tankers- restricted in   between 06.00 hrs and   22.00 hrs.
• RESTRICTION OF HGV/MGV/LGV.
1. HGVs restricted between 08.00 hrs. and 22.00 hrs. 
2.  MGVs / LGVs restricted in between 08.00 hrs. and 12.00 hrs. &   16.00 hrs. and 22.00 hrs. In added area MGVs / LGVs restricted in between 08.00 hrs. and 12.00 hrs. &   16.00 hrs. and 20.00 hrs.
3. Relaxation has been provided for LGVs from 12.00 hrs to 16.00 hrs.
4. Goods vehicles having gross vehicle weight up to 1600 KG do not come under the purview of the above time bound restrictions.

Inviting kind attention of our esteemed members. This is in reference to our post a few days back regarding constituting a '' facebook friends' forum'' wherein willing members would have a fortnightly/monthly face-to-face interaction  with the senior officers of Kolkata Traffic Police to discuss/share  views/suggestions/criticisms for improving traffic management in the city. The response, to say the least, has been overwhelming. Our heartfelt thanks and gratitude to all those who have kindly volunteered to participate and also to those who have had encouraging words for the venture. We propose to hold the first interactive session this Saturday, 16.6.12,  at Briefing Room, Lalbazar at 4 PM. Mails/ telephone calls will go from our end in the form of a formal invitation to the members who have volunteered so far to participate. Since the time that the members would be sparing on a weekend is precious,we would ideally want to limit the duration of the interaction/discussion to a maximum of one and a half hour / two hours . It would, therefore , be helpful if the participants come prepared with their views/observations/suggestions etc so as to make optimum use of the available time. Would remain grateful if the members could please confirm their participation by mailing at octcc@kolkatatrafficpolice.gov.in.  Would further request members to indicate their modes of conveyance so that we could make necessary parking arrangements. For any further queries, members may mail at the afore-mentioned mail id or contact Sgt Nilesh Choudhury ( 9830244145/ nilesh1304@gmail.com), Sgt Sudipto Mukherjee (9836863377/  sudipto.pri@gmail.com) . Would also request members to please try to reach Lalbazar by 3 45 PM on the scheduled date so that we could start the session sharp at 4 PM. Our officers and men will be present at the main  gate to facilitate the entry and parking. Please do spare some time from your busy schedules to make Kolkata a 'faster, safer and friendlier' city. It merits mention here that  in the inaugural session this Saturday we would be inviting only those who had volunteered to participate till date. The forum, however, remains open. Esteemed members willing to participate in the next session ( in the month of July) may please share their phone no/mail id so that we could invite them therein. Kolkata Traffic Police is eagerly looking forward to a meaningful interaction with the members of this fast-growing FB page. Thanks and warmest regards. 

Supratim Sarkar

Joint CP ( Traffic )

The Traffic Lokadalat  organised last Saturday at Sealdah Court has been a hugely successful one. A total of 10 courts functioned simultaneously to dispose  long-pending traffic violation cases, both pre-litigation and post-litigation ones. A total of 34,852 (an all-time record) cases were disposed in a day resulting in a realisation of revenue worth more than Rs 19 lakh to the Government through the court of Chief Judicial Magistrate.  The process involved months of painstaking spadework with the judiciary and meticulous record-building by a team of officers of MTV (minor traffic violations),FSTP (fatal squad, traffic police) and TCC (traffic computer cell). The idea was to lessen the burden of thousands of cases lying pending for years together in one go on one hand, and allow people to settle their fines through a harassment-free legal mechanism on the other. The participation was overwhelming. More such lokadalats are being organised shortly. Thanks and regards.
Supratim Sarkar
Joint CP (Traffic)

Inviting kind attention of the esteemed members of this page. The Facebook page of Kolkata Traffic Police now boasts of membership of close to 11,000 of well-wishing citizens. The rate of growth in membership over the last half a year or so has been phenomenal and active participation of the citizens has helped this page evolve into an effective enforcement tool on one hand, and a medium for meaningful self-introspection and development on the other. Some of the members post regularly ,some occasionally and some very rarely. At this end , we make sincere efforts to accord due priority to all suggestion/ observation/ criticisms. At times, we succeed in matching the expectations of the members; there are times when we are  found wanting . But trust us, we keep trying our best . With a view to making the page more participatory and the interaction a little more structured, we have been wondering whether we could constitute a "facebook friends' forum" wherein the senior officers of Kolkata  Traffic Police have a face-to-face interactive session for an hour or so with say , 25/30 willing members every fortnight / month at the Traffic Headquarters at Lalbazar on a date and time  of mutual convenience. Since sparing time on weekdays would obviously be difficult for the members , the interaction could be scheduled on Saturday afternoon /evening or as the members may find convenient. The  idea is to have a frank and no holds-barred exchange  of views and find ways to improve traffic management in the city. The venture can taste success only if the members participate in large numbers. We propose to hold the first such interactive session this month itself. Would humbly request members to share their views on the idea. Would further request members willing to participate to share their address and phone numbers /mail id so that we could intimate them in advance about the date and time. The support of the citizens, we have always maintained ,is our principal  source of sustenance and we hope this proposed venture of ours would also be blessed with your support /encouragement /cooperation. Let us all work together for a 'faster ,safer and friendlier' Kolkata. Thanks and warm regards.

Supratim Sarkar
Joint CP (Traffic)

Here are a few snapshots of unauthorisedly parked vehicles including Kolkata Police vehicles being removed by wreckers during the course of a special drive by Headquarter Traffic guard along B.B.Ganguly street this afternoon. Just to add, posts about traffic violations by KP personnel, particularly about helmetless driving and faulty number plates are quite frequent in this page. This is to assure you that all such posts are given due attention and offenders are lawfully dealt with. Efforts are on in right earnest to ensure that such aberrations remain exceptions and not the rule. Kolkata Traffic Police values the observations of the people it serves and seeks tirelessly to bring about better adherence to the rules of the roads. Please do criticise us when the need be; we welcome it; but also do kindly spare a thought for the KTP personnel toiling hard on the streets day in and day out in the sweltering  heat .
Thanks and regards,
Supratim Sarkar
Joint CP,Traffic

Unauthorised collection of parking fees by touts, especially during night (beyond traffic hours) is a menace and KTP has been trying hard to curb this through surprise night raids. 3 specific cases of cheating, criminal conspiracy and extortion have been initiated during the course of these raids over the last few days under Lake P.S.(near Priya Cinema), Tollygunge P.S.(near Menoka Cinema) and Hare Street P.S.(Bentinck Street). 9 touts have been arrested in these cases. The drive is on. Would remain grateful to the esteemed members of this page for sharing specific information about unauthorised collection of parking fees, specially during night. The menace may not be curbed completely, but we are trying to give it our best shot.
Regards.
Supratim Sarkar, 
Jt. CP(TP)

We are aware that the problem of taxi-refusal still persists despite our best efforts. This post is just to assure the esteemed members of this page that there has been no let -up in our sustained efforts to curb and minimise the menace to the best extent possible. Regular  prosecutions at refusal-prone crossings by the traffic guards as well as raids by plain-clothed decoys of KTP's Special raid section masquerading as passengers are being done in right earnest, resulting in a record prosecution figure of 2645 since the beginning of March till date and suspension of licenses of a good many of the errant drivers. Our plain-clothed teams are catching the errant drivers unawares. Here are a few snapshots of KTP outsmarting the culprits . 
Thanks and regards.
Supratim Sarkar,
Joint CP(Traffic)

KOLKATA TRAFFIC POLICE

Online payment of fines for road traffic violations:

Kolkata Traffic Police is pleased to announce the resumption of the system of online payment of traffic fines for road traffic violations in association with the State Bank of India using either debit/credit card or through Net Banking facility of SBI.  The service will enable vehicle owners to check online the number of pending traffic violation cases against their vehicles and allow them to pay fines through our website.  This will, on one hand, ensure better maintenance of records and on the other, will make the payment of fines more user-friendly and hassle-free.

The following steps are to be followed while making online payments:
.	Go to Kolkata Traffic Police official website: http://www.kolkatatrafficpolice.org/ or http://kolkatatrafficpolice.gov.in
.	Click on “Make Online Payment” in the left side menu
.	Provide vehicle number (without giving any space)
.	Enter last 5 digit of chassis number
.	Enter e-mail id and mobile number (optional)
.	The site will furnish a list of all pending cases against the concerned vehicle
.	Click on ‘Pay’ button
.	Select your payment option: Credit / Debit card or Net Banking
.	In case of payment through Credit / Debit card, the details of the card have to be provided as per the requirements of the bank.
.	In case of SBI Net Banking, only those having accounts with SBI can avail the facility on providing username and password.
.	Once the payment process is completed, acknowledgement details will be furnished.  A printout of the same may be kept by the vehicle-owner for record.

                             ----------------------------
Supratim Sarkar
Jt. CP (Traffic)

@ Terence Mandle Ref- F/B 201  Dt. 25.02.12. This is to inform you that it is important to understand that P.A.Shah Rd. had turned out to be the major arterial connection of the traffic plying to two ends of expending city. The traffic goes green starting from traffic moving from West to East and South = 10 second, then it is East to West for 20 seconds. Traffic coming from Golf Green is allowed to infiltrate for this entire period. Now the signal turns green for the entire North  Bound traffic for 10 second. The entire systematic process for disposal for 60 second completing the entire cycles.
It is an absurd thing in Kolkata to find any traffic police man sleeping inside the booth  when the entire road is choked. 
The Jadavpur xing is always manned by two constable and one traffic Sgt. during traffic hours with constant watch of O/C or Addl. O/C.

Sustained drives against Taxi- refusals, as we had mentioned in a few earlier posts, are on, resulting in suspension of licences of more then hundred errant drivers over the last couple of months, not to speak of the large number of daily prosecutions .To infuse an element of surprise, special plain-clothed teams of K T P are regularly send to refusal-prone crossing while the uniformed party stations itself nearby. While it is obviously impossible to change the behavioural pattern and mindset  of close to 50,000 taxi-drivers overnight  merely through enforcement, strict vigil to the extent possible, surprise raids on a regular basis and prompt penal action do help in curbing the menace .During the course of special plain–clothed raids by  KTP over the last 48 Hours, licences of 12 errant drivers have been seized for suspension and 31 prosecutions have been launched on basis of telephonic /SMS/FB complaints. 
Sharing the pictures of a few offending drivers at Dharmatala crossing who were caught unawares by KTP.  Dear members, let us join hands in a crusade against the menace of taxi-refusals.  This is to reiterate that in case of refusals, you can sent SMS to 575756 with TAXI<space>vehicle number…,time, place) or also can lodge complain over telephone by dialing 98300-10000, 98308-11111 or 2214-3644 

Thanks and regards,

Supratim Sarkar
Jt. CP (Traffic)

@ Sarojesh Mukherjee (ref your F/B No 43 dt 15.01.12) Thanks for your good observation. As soon as after getting your information we communicated with proper authority. The authority inspected the light signal along with concerned agency and they surveyed the situation. Actually it is technically fault as you observed. The concerned authority assured it to repair immediately on 18.01.12 without fail.

@ Sarojesh Mukherjee ref your F/B No 42 dt 15.01.12 this is to inform you that the actual situation is that the signal system is -from red to green & green to red it will via yellow light blinking. So in this regards from southern side yellow light is blinking for next turn to red the vehicle would not move from this side. And circle signal when blinking with yellow and north bound signal turned to red, the circle signal turned to green. From signalling system it is not defective.

Posts about traffic rule violations by police personnel have become quite common on this page.  This is to reiterate that such posts are most welcome from the members so that corrective steps/legal actions could be initiated.  Please do not remain sceptical about the authenticity of such actions. Please also note that based on FB complaint no 470 dt 25.10.2011, FB complaint no 538 dt 24.11.2011 and FB complaint no 05 dt 02.01.2012, prosecution have been launched vide case no pgTW00007/11 dt 25.10.2011, pgTW00008/11 & pgTW00009/11 dt 24.11.2011 and pgTW00001/12 dt. 02.01.2012 [‘pg’ stands for Public Grievance and ‘TW’ for two-wheelers].  Prosecution apart, the violators are departmentally dealt with as well  by Kolkata Police.
Exceptions/aberrations may still be there, but trust us, KTP is trying hard to ensure that such violations are curbed to the minimal extent possible.
Thanks and regards.

Supratim Sarkar,
 Jt. CP (Traffic)

The Kolaveri ad of Kolkata Traffic Police has drawn encouraging response. A 15-second animation film on the theme has recently been made which is being screened in a large number of cinema halls / multiplexes to make our citizens aware of the dangers of helmetless driving.  Please check it out.

Supratim Sarkar,
 Jt. CP (Traffic)

Kolkata Traffic Police Parents on two-wheelers on the city streets often allow the kids to ride without helmet, while they themselves put on the customary headgear, posing grave danger to the kids’ safety. Hence comes the latest Kolkata Traffic Police awareness campaign: ‘KHOKABABU jai, helmet kothay?’. Please don’t let kids ride without helmets.

Supratim Sarkar,
Jt. CP (Traffic)

This is to inform the citizens that in addition to our website, this page and other existing means of communication of grievances/complaints/allegations, Kolkata Traffic Police has put in place a dedicated public grievances cell to enquire and act on purely traffic-related matters. Please feel free to voice your grievances/complaints at pgcelltp@kolkatatrafficpolice.gov.in. A handpicked team of officers and force will ensure prompt enquiry and initiate necessary action as and when required along with a feedback to the complainant. Please do let your grievances/problems reach us so that we can act on the same. Thanks and regards to all

@Bapi kar, Ref:- FB-468 dt. 24.10.11 this is to inform you that action as proposed without making provision in law would be bad in law. However, by virtue of power vested in Rule 3 of the west Bengal Motor Vehicle Rules, 1989, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Traffic Department can exercise the power of revocation/disqualification of driving licence as provided in section 19 of the MV Act. 1988, only in respect of Transport Vehicles and the same is being exercised by the Deputy Commissioner of Police, Traffic to cope up with the nuisance like refusal by taxi drivers.

@ Mr. Tapobrata Roy, Ref:- FB-398 dt. 24.09.11 this is to inform you that being a law abiding citizen, everybody should abide by the traffic rules and regulations and traffic signals on your journey should be followed, otherwise accident may occur. The volume of traffic is increasing day by day and considering the circumstances traffic signal posts are installed along the roads for smooth flow of traffic in a discipline-way. The Kolkata Police deals with huge volume of traffic and so many appreciation received from the different corner of the citizen but constructive  criticism is always welcomed. As the Kolkata Police is trying hard in managing huge volume of traffic, the Govt. of West Bengal handed over vast area to Kolkata Police.
The comparison in traffic management with the WBP is baseless, as the KP is to deal with huge volume of traffic .

@ Mr. Banibrata Dey, Ref:- FB-409 dt. 27.10.11 this is to inform you that an enquiry was made into the matter. It reveals from the enquiry that Sgt. S. Howli of Ultadanga Traffic Guard was booked for duty to drive against unauthorized parking with wrecker in and around M.M. Rd. , CIT Rd. As the M/C bearing registration No- WB01Z-8908 was parked in "No Parking Zone" and a case was initiated agains...t the Motor Cycle. Another four vehicles was also prosecuted and deposited to Phoolbagan P.S. All the vehicles were released after realization of wrecker charge of Rs. 100/- by the Police Station. It also reveals from the enquiry that no extra charge of Rs. 20/- was taken by the staff of Police Station. It is further stated that one citation case is pending against the concerned motor cycle. The case initiated against the vehicle is justified.

Ref:- F/B 341 Dt. 12.09.11 @Sourav Biswas   this is to inform you that the area in and around Anandapur have just come into Kolkata police jurisdiction ( from 01.09.11) and the officers of Kasba Traffic Guard have taken initiative steps to sort out the problems. Both sides of the pavement are encroached with hawkers and no space is available on footpath for the pedestrian traffic. As a result, the pedestrian have to avail carriageway which is not desirable from traffic point of view. The matter is sensational in nature and needs to be taken up with the local administration. However, Kolkata Traffic Police is trying hard to keep the smooth flow of traffic in the vicinity.
Co-operation from the local people is urgently required to improve the traffic circulation.
